*Crediamo nella diversità, nell’equità e nell’inclusione. Tutte le candidature saranno valutate senza discriminazioni di alcun tipo. Il talento non ha genere, età o provenienza: ha solo voglia di crescere e contribuire al successo comune.*

title: Enterprise Account Executive (Learning & Engagement)
description:
**Company Description**
 LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 Join us to transform the way the world works.
   

  

**Job Description**
 This role will be based in Milan.
   

  

 At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business. The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team.
   

  

 We are looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to join our team in tapping into potential client opportunities and generating new business. You will be responsible for responding to inbound inquiries as well as blanketing your region with outbound activity. You will strategically approach target companies and teams, identify the best technology options and sell corporate learning solutions. Although you strive to meet and exceed quota, you will always act in the best interest of the client.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Passion for sales acquisition and dream big approach
* Close business consistently at or above quota level
* Prospect relentlessly to build pipeline and to convert prospects into customer by being a trusted advisor
* Develop and execute a strategic plan for the territory and document and distribute competitive information
* Create reliable forecasts and be transparent and accountable with management on the pipeline status
* Listen to the needs of the market and share insights with product and marketing teams
* Invest in colleagues and give coaching and advice when you see an opportunity for improvement
* Work to develop and circulate the best practices that will be the foundation of this team
* Be proactive about solving problems even if they’re outside of your area and be ready to take on additional initiatives and responsibilities as they emerge
* Seek out opportunities to be a leader and do everything you can to help the company achieve its larger objectives


**Qualifications**
**Basic Qualifications:**
* 3\\+ years of applicable sales experience
* Business fluency in Italian and English


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience selling learning solutions, HR Tech (preferably HR software) or consultancy services (preferably in talent)
* Experience to sell and engage at C\\-level including HR, Talent Acquisition and Learning \\& Development
* Experience with SaaS opportunities management in CRM/Dynamics
* Strong negotiation and accurate forecasting skills
* Demonstrated ability to find, manage and close high\\-level business in an evangelist sales environment
* Ability to assess business opportunities and use data to inform decision making and persuade others
* Ability to manage a large number of prospect situations simultaneously while positioning company products against direct and indirect competitors


**Suggested Skills:**
* Prospecting
* Deal management
* Communication
* Analytical Skills and Data Driven
* Forecasting
* Negotiation and closing


**Additional Information**
**Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates**
 Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate\\-portal.

title: Junior - Analytics & AI | Milan
description:
**Junior – Analytics \\& AI\\| Milan**
 The chance to build a better future is right in front of you
   

  

**Do Work That Matters** 
**\\- Your role and responsibilities**
 Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges.
 **KPMG Advisory** 
 offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions. When you join the Analytics \\& AI team in Milan , you are going to work on tech
 **financial projects** 
 for top\\-tier clients in different sectors.
   

  

 Specifically, you will be tasked with:
   

  

* Innovative Software Development:


 Build and maintain high\\-performance applications and microservices that underpin data analytics platforms;
   

  

 Develop robust APIs and integration layers to seamlessly connect various internal and external data sources.
   

  

* Data Pipeline Engineering:


 Design, implement, and optimize data ingestion and transformation pipelines to process high\\-volume datasets from diverse energy systems and sensors;
   

  

 Ensure data quality and integrity through testing, validation and monitoring processes.
   

  

* Advanced Analytics \\& Visualization:


 Collaborate with data scientists to integrate machine learning algorithms and predictive modeling into live production environments;
   

  

 Create interactive dashboards and reporting tools that transform raw data into actionable insights for technical and non\\-technical stakeholders.
   

  

* System Optimization \\& Scalability:


 Enhance system performance through code optimization, cost optimization, robust testing, and effective resource management;
   

  

 Implement scalable solutions that support growing data demands and evolving business needs in the client domain.
   

  

* Agile Collaboration:


 Participate in agile development practices, including sprint planning, code reviews, and continuous integration, to ensure efficient delivery of features and improvements;
   

  

 Work closely with cross\\-disciplinary teams, including business analysts, data engineers, and product managers, to align technological advancements with strategic objectives.
   

  

**Skills**
**Come As You Are \\- Your skills and characteristics**
 This is the perfect opportunity if you have:
   

  

* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field;
* Some knowledge in software engineering with a strong understanding of full\\-stack development;
* Proficiency in modern programming languages (e.g., Python, Java, Javascript or similar) and experience working with data processing frameworks;
* Some knowledge with API development, cloud platforms, and containerization technologies;
* Familiarity with data visualization tools and basic statistical modeling techniques;
* Excellent problem\\-solving skills and the ability to communicate technical concepts clearly to diverse audiences.


**Your Future With Us \\- What you’ll find at KPMG**
* A dynamic workplace at the forefront of digital transformation in the energy sector, where innovative ideas are encouraged and realized.
* Opportunities to acquire leading certifications (Azure, Google Cloud, AWS, Databricks) and engage in challenging projects that accelerate your technical and professional learning curve.
* Immediate exposure to live data challenges, where you can apply your skills to solve authentic business problems and see the impact of your work in real time.
* Join a collaborative, agile team that values creativity, technical excellence, and practical problem solving, facilitating rapid prototyping and successful project deployments (from PoCs to MVPs).
* Tailored compensation packages and benefits designed to support both your personal and professional success.


**Together for Better – Our values and commitment**
 Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the
 **KPMG** 
**values** 
 that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can
 **achieve their full potential** 
 .
   

  

 As a result of our commitment to fostering an
 **inclusive work** 
 environment, our Network complies with the standards of the
 **ISO 30415** 
 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and
 **UNI PdR 125** 
 , relating to gender equality” . Within our
 **Impact Plan** 
 \\- Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) \\- you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.
   

  

**Join us!**
 Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation \\- “GDPR”), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG’s privacy policy .
   

  

 KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Guardia Particolare Giurata per la nostra Centrale Operativa
description:
**Chi siamo** 
 : il Gruppo Fidelitas S.p.A. leader nel settore della Vigilanza Privata in Italia, forte di un organico di oltre 2000 risorse, assicura una presenza capillare dal Nord al Centro Italia. La nostra Centrale Operativa è il cuore pulsante delle nostre operazioni di sicurezza, dove monitoriamo costantemente le attività e rispondiamo con prontezza a qualsiasi situazione di emergenza.
   

  

**Cosa farai**

* Risposta rapida e coordinata a situazioni di emergenza, garantendo la sicurezza dei beni dei clienti.

* Comunicazione efficace con le autorità competenti per garantire una risposta tempestiva ed efficace in caso di emergenza.


**Requisiti** 
 :

* Buona conoscenza degli strumenti informatici.
* Eccellenti capacità di comunicazione e gestione dello stress.
* Possesso di titoli prefettizi in corso di validità (Decreto e Porto d’arma) o disponibilità al conseguimento.
* Disponibilità a lavorare in turni rotativi, compresi i turni notturni e festivi.
* Patente di guida tipo B (automunito/a).


**Cosa offriamo** 
 :
   

  

* Possibilità di assunzione con contratto a tempo indeterminato.

* Opportunità di formazione e sviluppo professionale.
* Buoni pasto.


 Il/la candidat\\* ideale ha il domicilio o la residenza in provincia di Bergamo ed ha maturato una pregressa esperienza nella mansione, preferibilmente all'interno di Centrali Operative.
   

  

**Unisciti al nostro team** 
 , nel nostro impegno per garantire la sicurezza e la tranquillità dei nostri clienti. Invia il tuo curriculum vitae. Saremo lieti di conoscerti e valutare la tua candidatura!
   

  

 Sede di lavoro:
 **Bergamo.**

title: Posizione A Specialista Tecnico Ambientale e di Transizione Ecologica - CONCORSO PUBBLICO, PER ESAMI, N. 16 POSTI A TEMPO PIENO E INDETERMINATO NELL’AREA DEI FUNZIONARI E DELL’ELEVATA QUALIFICAZIONE.
description:
**Posizione A Specialista Tecnico Ambientale e di Transizione Ecologica**
 N° posti messi a bando: 3 posti a Milano.
   

  

 Il possesso di questo profilo professionale comporta la capacità di sviluppare le attività di seguito specificate, così da assicurarne lo svolgimento nell'ambito delle corrispondenti posizioni di lavoro:
   

  

  

* istruttoria di tipo tecnico\\-amministrativo per piani, programmi, procedimenti autorizzativi e interventi in materia di ambiente, disinquinamento, bonifiche suolo e falda, gestione rifiuti, economia circolare;
* studi e ricerche ed elaborazione dei dati e delle informazioni in materia di ambiente, disinquinamento, bonifiche suolo e falda gestione rifiuti, economia circolare;
* valutazione e analisi di interventi in materia di ambiente, disinquinamento, bonifiche suolo e falda, gestione rifiuti, economia circolare;
* predisposizione di pareri, atti e documenti relativi a proposte di determinazione su progetti in materia di ambiente, disinquinamento, bonifiche suolo e falda, gestione rifiuti, economia circolare
* implementazione sistemi informativi territoriali.


**Requisiti specifici**
 Essere in possesso di uno dei seguenti titoli di studio, secondo la classificazione del MIUR:
   

  

 Lauree triennali (lauree di primo livello) \\- (L) \\- (ex D.M. 270/04\\):
   

  

 L\\-7 (Ingegneria Civile e Ambientale);
   

  

 L\\-13 (Scienze biologiche)
   

  

 L\\-25 (Scienze e tecnologie agrarie e forestali)
   

  

 L\\-27 (Scienze e tecnologie chimiche)
   

  

 L\\-32 (Scienze e tecnologie per l’ambiente e la natura)
   

  

 L\\-34 (Scienze geologiche)
   

  

 Corsi di laurea magistrale (ex D.M. 270/04\\):
   

  

 LM\\-06 (Biologia)
   

  

 LM\\-22 (Ingegneria chimica)
   

  

 LM\\-23 (Ingegneria civile)
   

  

 LM\\-35 (Ingegneria per l’ambiente e il territorio)

title: IMPIEGAT* JUNIOR BACK OFFICE COMMERCIALE ITALIA/ESTERO
description:
**Chi siamo**
 Lombardo è un’azienda italiana con una lunga storia di successo, costruita sul dialogo costante con installatori e progettisti. Ogni nostro prodotto nasce per rispondere alle reali esigenze del mercato, unendo estetica, innovazione e produzione 100% Made in Italy. Offriamo soluzioni sicure, affidabili e di facile installazione, affiancando continuamente l’offerta attuale con nuove proposte in linea con la visione aziendale.
   

  

 Posizione:
   

  

 Siamo alla ricerca di un\\*
 *Impiegat\\* Junior* 
 da inserire nel team commerciale con mansioni di
 **back office** 
 e supporto agli Area Manager e alle attività commerciali.
   

  

**Principali attività:**
* Supporto nella preparazione di offerte commerciali
* Gestione delle comunicazioni con i clienti via telefono ed e\\-mail
* Inserimento e aggiornamento ordini
* Partecipazione a fiere e meeting aziendali (ove richiesto)
* Attività di back office e assistenza post\\-vendita


 Requisiti:
   

  

* Tedesco fluente (orale e scritto) – requisito fondamentale
* Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
* Attitudine al lavoro in team e buone doti relazionali
* Precisione, proattività e spirito di iniziativa
* Gradita ma non indispensabile un’esperienza precedente in ruoli simili


 Altre informazioni:

 Full time: Lun–Gio 8:00–12:30 / 14:00–17:30 \\| Ven 8:00–16:00 (orario continuato)
   

  

**Sede:**

**Cosa offriamo:**
 Ambiente giovane, dinamico e in crescita, con percorso di formazione e possibilità di sviluppo professionale.
   

  

**Candidature:**
 Inviare il proprio CV a:
 **risorse.umane@lombardo.it**
*Crediamo nella diversità, nell’equità e nell’inclusione. Tutte le candidature saranno valutate senza discriminazioni di alcun tipo. Il talento non ha genere, età o provenienza: ha solo voglia di crescere e contribuire al successo comune.*

title: Credit Risk Analyst (f/m/x)
description:
**Position Overview**
 For over 150 years, our dedication to being the Global Hausbank for our clients has been driven by our people – in around 60 countries and across more than 150 nationalities.
   

  

 Their deep understanding, insights, expertise, and passion help our clients navigate an increasingly complex world – be it in our Corporate Bank, our Private Bank, our Investment Bank or our Asset Management division.
   

  

 Together we can make a great impact for our clients home and abroad, securing their lasting success and financial security.
   

  

 The Credit Risk Management Corporate Bank \\& Investment Bank unit (within Chief Risk Officer department) is seeking a Credit Analyst, who will be responsible for Credit analysis and monitoring of a portfolio of Italian MidCaps Corporates.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Perform good quality credit analysis, analysis of financial and economic performance, identification of risk drivers and evaluation of downcase scenarios.
* Support senior credit officers in managing credit requests analyzing risk/ reward profile of the transaction proposed, proactively propose risk mitigating structures.
* Ensure efficient, correct and accurate and timely response to business requests.
* Monitor and report of credit exposures, identify early warning signals.
* Prepare the documentation for Credit Committee and Senior Management Committees.
* Represent and prepare for Internal Audits/ Regulators.


**Skills**
* Graduate and/ or post graduate degree in business/finance (or a similar field of study).
* Knowledge of credit products, credit documentation and credit approval process.
* Attitude to credit related regulatory requirements.
* Understanding of potential risks (reputational, compliance, legal issues) related to credit approval process.
* Self\\-motivated, structured approach and a strong attention to details paired with synthesis ability.
* Proven ability to multi\\-task different projects and prioritize.
* Ability to build cross\\-divisional as well as cross\\-regional relationships.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (and Italian).
* Proficient in Microsoft Office applications including strong Excel skills.


 Well\\-being \\& Benefits
   

  

 Emotionally and mentally balanced: We encourage work\\-life balance, and we are committed to provide an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. We support you in dealing with life crises, maintaining stability through illness, and maintaining good mental health. We promote a culture where you can openly speak about mental health (Personal Support Line).
   

  

 Physically thriving: We support you in managing your physical health by taking appropriate preventive measures and providing insurance coverage and welfare benefits.
   

  

 Socially connected: We strongly believe in collaboration, inclusion and feeling connected to open up new perspectives and strengthen our self\\-confidence and well\\-being; we organize conferences, webinar and networking opportunities to share diversity, equity and inclusion contents.
   

  

 Financially secure: We support you in meeting personal financial goals during your active career and for the future. Benefit from meal allowance, Pension Fund, Welfare Plan, banking services for employees.
   

  

 We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.
   

  

 Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.
   

  

 We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all\\-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.
   

  

 To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands\\-on approach of an operator.
   

  

 For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
   

  

**A few examples of your responsibilities** 
* **Master your toolkit.** 
 By working across diverse tech stacks, you’ll refine your ability to choose the right tools for every challenge. From monolithic to microservices architectures, gRPC to REST APIs, Kubernetes to Docker, Python to Rust—you’ll show that true expertise isn’t about using the trendiest technologies, but about understanding their purpose to unleash their full potential.
* **Build stuff that matters.** 
 Regardless of your seniority, you’ll enjoy plenty of autonomy and take full ownership of your work, from ideation to execution. You’ll have the unique opportunity to build software from the ground up and witness firsthand how your code evolves into a product used at scale.
* **Simplify relentlessly.** 
 Is every component essential? Do we need this process? As a Bending Spoons engineer, your mission is to turn complexity into simplicity. Whether optimizing CI/CD pipelines, writing maintainable code, or crafting minimalist architectures, your drive to simplify will power scalable, future\\-proof solutions.


**What we look for** 
* **Reasoning ability.** 
 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
* **Drive.** 
 You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
* **Team spirit.** 
 You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
* **Proficiency in English.** 
 You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


**What we offer** 
* **Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams.** 
 You’ll work in small, result\\-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
* **An exceptional opportunity for growth.** 
 We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top\\-of\\-the\\-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment \\& contract**
 Permanent or fixed\\-term. Full\\-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They’re challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities—just let us know through this form.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 If you’ve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.
   

  

 To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long\\-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.
   

  

 If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.

title: Senior Associate - Private Equity  – Digital Infrastructure
description:
**Overview:** 




  





 Our client, a Milan\\-based alternative investment manager with \\~€2 billion in assets and strong roots in renewable energy and infrastructure, is embarking on a strategic expansion into the digital infrastructure domain. This new platform will deploy a €500 million fund over coming months targeting data centres, fibre networks, edge / space infrastructure across Western Europe
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Market research, screening, financial modelling, and due diligence in digital infrastructure sectors
* Support transaction execution, structuring, and integration
* Assist in coordinating technical, operational, legal, regulatory inputs
* Help build internal frameworks / playbooks for digital infrastructure investments
* Report on performance, risk, and sector trends to senior team



  





**Candidate Profile:** 




  




* 3–5 years in private equity, strategy consulting, infrastructure finance, or advisory (preferably with some tech / telecom / energy overlap)
* Experience in Western Europe, ideally across multiple markets (e.g. Italy, Germany, France, Nordics).
* Fluent English, Italian.
* Strong analytical, modelling, and commercial sense
* Curiosity for technology infrastructure (data centres, fibre, connectivity)
* Ability to work in a growing team and adapt to entrepreneurial, dynamic context
* Bonuses, carry expectations should be discussed

title: SAINT LAURENT Client Advisor
description:
**Summary**
 Founded in 1961, Yves Saint Laurent was the first couture house to introduce the concept of luxury prêt\\-à\\-porter in a 1966 collection called ‘Rive Gauche’, synonymous with youth and freedom. This shift represented a first critical step in the modernization of fashion and revolutionized the socio\\-cultural landscape.
   

 In 1999, the luxury goods division of the Kering Group acquired Yves Saint Laurent and, under the creative direction of Anthony Vaccarello since April 2016, continues to position the house at the summit of the luxury universe.
   

 Today, Saint Laurent collections include women’s and men’s ready\\-to\\-wear, shoes, handbags, small leather goods, jewelry, scarves, ties and eyewear.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Role**
 Reporting to the Department Manager, the Sales Assistant contributes actively to the store sales, by providing a remarkable service to all internal and external clients, supporting the management team and representing the Company brand and image.
   

  

**Mission**
 A Business Developper:
   

  

 Maximize sales and provide excellent customer and after\\-sales service
   

  

 Actively develop new clients and consistently strengthen existing client relationships
   

  

 A Team Player:
   

  

 Participate in maintaining a positive work environment
   

  

                                                                                                                          
   

  

 A Brand Promoter:
   

  

 Promote the brand’s culture internally and externally
   

  

 Ensure that the image of the Store is in line with corporate standards
   

  

 Guarantee excellent customer experience
   

  

 A Process Supporter:
   

  

 Support the Management in all the store processes compliance and follow\\-up
   

  

**Profile**
* Commitment to take part in an innovative project
* Product sensitivity and a strong market and fashion trends knowledge, a good general culture level
* Excellent interpersonal skills, good listening ability
* Adaptability, Natural Curiosity, Authenticity
* Availability, reactivity
* Open\\-minded and/or creativity driven
* Sales driven, social, open and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism.
* A friendly and helpful approach to our customers and colleagues.
* Be open to feedback and communicate with your team and managers in a clear and straightforward way.
* Ability to multitask and handle the pressure of a busy day.
* A willingness to learn and improve
* A 2\\.0/ digital approach


*Saint Laurent is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms – gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation – enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background.*
**Job Type**
 Regular
   

  

**Start Date**
 2025\\-11\\-01
   

  

**Schedule**
 Full time
   

  

**Organization**
 SL Luxury Retail S.r.l.

title: Business Analyst Intern
description:
**Job Description – Business Analyst Intern @ Fintech District** 








 Would you like to be part of the point of reference for the Italian Fintech Ecosystem and developing new projects and opportunities with an Open innovation approach?
 



 Fintech District is a community with over 400 companies, from startups to big corporations, that connects the most relevant national and international stakeholders, adopting a collaborative approach aimed at supporting dialogue and encouraging co\\-creation within the community.
 



  





 We are looking for a rock star business analyst intern for an initial period of 6 months with chances to become part of the team on a full time base afterwards.
 







**What you offer us:** 



* Passionate about developing insights and designing innovation\\-focused projects on tech\\-related fields and the broader financial services industry
* You will also take on project management activities in areas adjacent to the financial world, including initiatives focused on building and nurturing communities.
* You are constantly informed on trends in the Fintech world and Open Finance in Italy and abroad
* Ability to create presentations in Power Point and organize knowledge materials for the benefit of the team and our stakeholders
* Ability to work with numbers in Excel and gather insights from them
* Interest in working on projects involving several stakeholders and business units of big corporations to launch new tech products on the market
* Ability to speak and write in business English (We only use English in all our presentations, often participate in meetings with foreign people, and this is a role requiring international interactions)







**What we offer you:** 



* The greatest intern experience you could ask for, you’ll be working side to side with a diverse team of solid professionals getting inputs, learning every day and receiving feedback on your work
* The chance to make a real impact and see your work valued and brought to the senior leadership
* A startup environment where jackets and ties are not required to do business (and an informal outfit is encouraged😉)
* Flexibility to manage your personal life and work remotely part of your weeks, as long as results are achieved
* A young, friendly and informal work environment
* A chance to make the difference and become part of the team on a full time base in 6 months







**What you’ll need to succeed:** 



* Interest in the tech ecosystem, in startups and what is happening in the world of financial services above and beyond just Italy
* An eclectic profile and the will to become an analyst but will also grow in all the areas of the business being able to support business development, community activities and projects
* A no\\-frills, can\\-do and roll\\-up your sleeves attitude with the will to continue learning and improving yourself
* Always eager to learn, not being afraid to speak up constructively, but knowing to listen when it is important to do that.

title: Stage Funzione Business Support

 e la

 .
   

  

 Nata da queste esperienze di successo, Mediobanca Premier unisce il

**consulenti** 
 , le
 **tecnologie** 
 più avanzate e l’
 **esperienza** 
**di Mediobanca**

**Approccio responsabile, profonda conoscenza dei mercati e soluzioni di investimento evolute**

 Il risultato è un’offerta distintiva di

 capace di

 **progettualità** 
 con un costante sguardo al futuro.
   

  

 Particolare cura è posta nella fase di recruitment attuata tramite l’inserimento di
 **giovani motivati** 
 e
 **specialisti con esperienza** 
 .
   

  

 Partendo dalla imprescindibile
 **valorizzazione delle competenze** 
 delle persone, frutto degli studi intrapresi ed esperienze professionali già maturate, in Mediobanca Premier abbiamo l'obiettivo di
 **incrementare skill e i know\\-how** 
 specialistici, le competenze tecniche di ruolo e quelle manageriali, contribuendo fattivamente ad accompagnare le persone in un percorso di crescita individuale e professionale.
   

  

 Posizione:
   

  

 La figura professionale ricercata sarà inserita in una struttura dedicata al supporto della Rete Proprietaria nella Funzione Business Support all’interno della Direzione Coordinamento e supporto Commerciale \\_ Direzione Centrale Commerciale
   

  

 All’interno della Funzione gli Uffici Business Support Investimenti e Business Support Banking, nei quali è previsto l’inserimento della figura ricercata, si occupano di:
   

  

* analizzare e risolvere i problemi del cliente relativamente all’operatività dei prodotti di risparmio e investimento/mutui e assicurazioni, prodotti transazionali/tematiche bancarie
* fornire un servizio di assistenza dedicata per la soluzione di problematiche operative della Clientela Wealth
* indirizzare eventuali problematiche alle strutture tecniche di 2^ livello, garantendone soluzione rapida e senza ricicli e nel rispetto del modello di servizio
* effettuare operazioni dispositive in ambito investimenti e analisi per la classificazione di clienti da retail a professional
* fornire supporto di “secondo livello” all’Outsourcer che gestisce telefonate (per i problemi dei clienti) e chat (per la parte di normativa interna emanata) provenienti dalle Filiali e dal Direct Advisory
* fornire assistenza dedicata all’apertura, gestione ed operatività della clientela Small Business
* gestire l’operatività legata ai rapporti fiduciari
* coadiuvare le altre Direzioni per la definizione dei requisiti di progetti/processi che hanno impatto sulle Filiali tramite partecipazione ai tavoli di lavoro e ai collaudi
* collaborare alla revisione di procedure e manuali operativi che hanno impatto sulle Filiali


 proporre e promuovere l’evoluzione dei processi commerciali in ottica multicanale e di miglioramento del servizio offerto alla Rete Proprietaria
   

  

 Requisiti:
   

  

 Il candidato deve possedere:
   

  

* un’ottima capacità relazionale e di ascolto attivo e collaborativo
* proattività nel cogliere i bisogni del cliente interno/esterno
* un’ottima capacità di analisi e problem solving
* una elevata flessibilità e predisposizione alla gestione di situazioni complesse, la cui risoluzione richiede spesso molteplici azioni e dinamicità
* una buona predisposizione al lavoro di squadra e alla condivisione continua


 Gradita conoscenza della lingua Inglese e del pacchetto office e degli applicativi in uso in Banca (Salesforce, Sec, Portali Assicurativi, ecc)
   

  

 Altre informazioni:
   

  

* Sede di lavoro: Milano
* CCNL Credito \\+ Benefit


 Per le aziende del Gruppo Mediobanca la diversità e l’inclusività sono valori fondamentali. Le persone interessate verranno considerate nel rispetto della diversità, valorizzando differenti caratteristiche di età, cultura, abilità e orientamento o espressione di genere.

title: Intern Analyst CS
description:
**Job Description**
 In the Customer Success area, you will support the clients in the daily management, participate in moments of gathering input on their business needs and be involved in the analysis and interpretation of client information in the decision\\-making process. You will respond to basic customer requests and will support the tutor during the client presentation.
   

  

 You will acquire skills related to the FMCG and distribution market, familiarize yourself with the most advanced tools and the main metrics for the analysis.
   

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**
* Support Customer Success executives in analyzing in\\-market data, studying results, and summarizing insights in emails, reports, and slides
* Manage basic client requests
* Deliver insights on FMCG/retail phenomena and consumer behaviors
* Be point of contact and interface with several company departments, in order to be a collector among them and the clients
* Prepares and delivers quantitative analysis and presentations (category overview as well as issue based) building a story and finalizing conclusions and proposes recommendations. Proposes calculation of Quantified Business Opportunity


**A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU:**
 Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You find potential in percentages. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you. You’re known for your impeccable organization. Connecting with colleagues matters to you, and that motivates you to sift through data for a new angle; with experience and using the most advanced tools you will become fast and agile in this. You can identify the narratives behind numbers, and you’re always looking for what’s next.
   

  

* Degree in Management, Economics, Marketing, Statistics, Information Management
* Native in Italian and good level of English
* Immediately available to start (beginning of November 2025\\)
* Excellent analysis and numerical reasoning skills
* Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills
* Interest in the consumer goods market
* Knowledge of Office Packages (Excel, PowerPoint)


**What we can offer:**
* Work in dynamic environment engaging with local and global companies
* Benefits \\& flexible working hours, hybrid work options
* Internal trainings will be provided together with detailed onboarding agenda
* Access to learning platforms
* Staff and team events


 \\#Hybrid
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Our Benefits**
* Flexible working environment
* Volunteer time off
* LinkedIn Learning
* Employee\\-Assistance\\-Program (EAP)


**About NIQ**
 NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state\\-of\\-the\\-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100\\+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.
   

  

 For more information, visit NIQ.com
   

  

 Want to keep up with our latest updates?
   

  

 Follow us on: LinkedIn \\| Instagram \\| Twitter \\| Facebook
   

  

**Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**
 At NIQ, we are steadfast in our commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace that mirrors the rich diversity of the communities and markets we serve. We believe that embracing a wide range of perspectives drives innovation and excellence. All employment decisions at NIQ are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We invite individuals who share our dedication to inclusivity and equity to join us in making a meaningful impact. To learn more about our ongoing efforts in diversity and inclusion, please visit the https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news\\-center/diversity\\-inclusion

description:
È indetta selezione pubblica per soli esami per l’assunzione, con contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato di n. 4 Istruttori amministrativo\\-contabili, Area degli Istruttori, di cui n. 3 a tempo pieno e n. 1 tempo parziale con assegnazione come di seguito specificato:
   

  

  

* n. 1 a tempo pieno presso la Provincia di Bergamo, Settore Edilizia Scolastica e Gestione del territorio, Servizio Patrimonio Espropri e Concessioni prioritariamente riservato a volontari forze armate;
* n. 1 a tempo pieno presso il Comune di Azzano San Paolo, Settore Servizi Tecnici prioritariamente riservato a volontari forze armate;
* n. 1 a tempo pieno presso il Comune di Azzano San Paolo, Settore Istruzione\\-cultura\\-sport prioritariamente riservato a operatori volontari che hanno concluso senza demerito il servizio civile universale e nazionale previsto dalla legge 64/2001;
* n. 1 a tempo parziale 83,33% (30 ore settimanali) presso il Comune di Azzano San Paolo, Settore Ragioneria.


 I requisiti di ammissione sono contenuti all'interno del bando di concorso allegato.
   

  

 È prevista una tassa di ammissione al concorso pubblico di € 10,00 (dieci/00\\).
   

  

 La domanda inoltrata per la partecipazione alla selezione deve contenere la dichiarazione dell’avvenuto versamento della tassa di ammissione, secondo le modalità di seguito specificate e la ricevuta di pagamento dovrà essere obbligatoriamente allegata alla domanda di partecipazione.
   

  

 Il versamento deve avvenire esclusivamente tramite la piattaforma digitale “pagoPA”.
   

  

 La domanda di ammissione deve essere presentata entro il termine perentorio di 30 (trenta) giorni, decorrenti dal giorno successivo alla data di pubblicazione del bando sul Portale Unico Reclutamento link www.inpa.gov.it, non oltre le ore 12\\.00\\.
   

  

 La domanda di partecipazione al concorso deve essere presentata, a pena di ESCLUSIONE, in VIA TELEMATICA, mediante apposita procedura accessibile dal portale InPA al seguente link https://www.inpa.gov.it/ attraverso i passaggi dettagliati nel bando di concorso.

title: AI Program Manager
description:
**Transform the everyday with us**
 Siemens is looking for an
 **AI Program Manager** 
 , to be hired with a permanent contract in Milan.
   

  

 Siemens is a global leader in technology with a strong focus on digitalization, electrification, and automation. In Italy, Siemens drives innovation and digital transformation across multiple industries, helping customers create value and preparing society for a more sustainable and efficient future.
   

  

 You love to create an impact? From Day 1 you are empowered to make a difference for a better tomorrow with your full potential and creativity.
   

  

**Your Challenge**
 As AI Program Manager your main responsibilities will be:
   

  

* Define and align the AI strategy with the guidelines set by the Digital Transformation Officer and in coordination with business units and central functions.
* Manage the AI program by coordinating multiple related projects, ensuring coherence and timely rollout.
* Identify and prioritize use cases based on market needs and internal opportunities.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams (Architecture, Sales, Marketing, Legal, IT) to ensure adoption of AI solutions.
* Drive delivery and execution by working closely with data scientists, engineers, and product owners, ensuring timelines and quality to enable scaling of strategic AI projects.
* Standardize processes, tools, and templates to accelerate AI adoption across the organization.
* Promote AI culture internally and lead change management initiatives, including training and awareness programs.
* Monitor market and competitor trends to continuously adapt the AI strategy.
* Ensure program governance including budget, KPIs, and risk management.
* Communicate the AI vision to internal and external stakeholders, providing thought leadership.
* Support the scalability of AI solutions in alignment with the Digital Factory Team, ensuring best practices and frameworks are applied.


 To be a perfect fit for this role, you would already have:
   

  

* Preferably 7\\+ years of experience in managing complex programs/projects, with at least 3 years in AI, Data Analytics, or Digital Transformation.
* University degree (Preferably Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, or similar).
* Solid technical knowledge of AI/ML, cloud, and data platforms, with familiarity in Agile and DevOps methodologies.
* Relevant certifications such as PMP, PMI\\-ACP, or equivalent preferred.
* Strong soft skills: leadership, effective communication, problem solving, and result orientation.
* Fluent English (Italian knowledge is a plus).


**What We Offer**
 Flexibility: a trust\\-based environment with an inclusive and flexible way of working driven by results; hybrid and remote working enabled by innovative tools and devices; wi\\-fi connection reimbursement.
   

  

 Welfare: flexible welfare programs and health insurance extendable to your family; professional and extra\\-professional accident insurance; free on\\-site lunch options.
   

  

 Never stop growing: plenty of opportunities for continuous and individual learning journeys.
   

  

 An inclusive team culture where you can be yourself.
   

  

 Join us and be yourself. Inclusion is our ambition!
   

  

 Siemens is an equal opportunity employer, offering a safe and inclusive work environment, based on mutual respect and the appreciation of uniqueness, guaranteeing equal employment opportunities to all qualified candidates to unleash their full potential.
   

  

 Address to us your desired working conditions/environment. Typically, this kind of position is full\\-time; however, please feel free to ask for a more flexible arrangement if that suits you better.
   

  

 Our recruiting team is looking forward to getting to know you!
   

  

**\\#MakeYourImpact**

title: Business Analyst
RF/EMC Specialist Engineer
description:
**Company Overview**

**SPACE INDUSTRIES** is a **dynamic and rapidly growing company** operating in the **aerospace sector**, with a strong commitment to **innovation, reliability, and mission excellence**.  

The company supports **complex space programs** and provides **end\\-to\\-end mission operations**, ensuring high standards of performance and operational success.

 **Position Overview**


Space Industries S.p.A., a leading aerospace company specializing in the **assembly, integration, and testing (AIT)** of **small satellites**, is seeking an **experienced RF/EMC Specialist Engineer** to manage and execute **Radio Frequency (RF)** and **ElectroMagnetic Compatibility (EMC)** testing campaigns within the company’s **anechoic test facility**.


The selected candidate will be responsible for **planning, performing, and analyzing RF and EMC tests** on satellite platforms, subsystems, and payloads, ensuring full compliance with **ECSS standards**, customer specifications, and space program requirements.


This position requires strong expertise in **RF measurements**, **EMC/EMI testing**, and **anechoic chamber operations**, combined with a deep understanding of **space hardware testing procedures**.

**Main Responsibilities**

* Plan, execute, and document **RF and EMC test campaigns** for **small satellites** and related equipment in accordance with **ECSS** and customer requirements.
* Operate **anechoic test facilities** and associated instrumentation (spectrum analyzers, signal generators, antennas, EMI receivers, LISNs, amplifiers).
* Define and implement **test setups**, wiring configurations, and instrumentation layouts.
* Perform **EMI/EMC**, **RF performance**, **antenna pattern**, and **radiated susceptibility** tests.
* Ensure compliance with applicable **ECSS\\-E\\-ST\\-20\\-07**, **MIL\\-STD\\-461**, and project\\-specific test standards.
* Analyze and interpret test data, identify anomalies, and prepare detailed **test reports**.
* Collaborate with **AIT**, **Engineering**, and **Product Assurance** teams for test planning and troubleshooting.
* Maintain calibration and functionality of RF and EMC test equipment.
* Support **test readiness reviews (TRR)** and participate in project reviews (TRB, QR, FR).
* Ensure adherence to **safety procedures** and **cleanroom/ESD requirements**.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of testing methodologies and facility capabilities.

**Requirements**

* Degree in **Electronics**, **Telecommunications**, **Aerospace Engineering**, or related fields.
* **Minimum 5 years of experience** in **RF and EMC testing** within the **aerospace** or **high\\-reliability** sector.
* Proven experience with **anechoic chamber operations** and RF measurement systems.
* In\\-depth knowledge of **ECSS**, **MIL\\-STD**, and **ESA/ASI** test standards.
* Hands\\-on experience with test equipment (spectrum analyzers, network analyzers, RF amplifiers, antennas, EMI receivers).
* Strong understanding of **RF systems**, **antennas**, and **EMC/EMI phenomena**.
* Proficiency in **data analysis**, **test reporting**, and root cause investigation.
* Excellent attention to detail and ability to manage complex test setups independently.
* Good communication skills and ability to work in a cross\\-functional team.
* Good command of **English** (written and spoken).
* Holder of a valid category B driving license.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience in **Small Satellite** or **ESA/ASI** programs.
* Familiarity with **satellite payloads** and **RF communication subsystems**.
* Knowledge of **test automation** tools and scripting (e.g. LabVIEW, Python).
* Certification or training in **EMC/RF testing** or **ECSS test standards**.

**Benefits**

**What We Offer:**

* A dynamic and stimulating work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Metalmeccanico (CCNL) with compensation based on experience and skills.

SPACE INDUSTRIES is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion within its workplace and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or any other characteristic**.**

**Why Join Us?**

A unique opportunity for professional growth in a young and dynamic aerospace company.


The chance to work on innovative projects with a global impact in the small satellite sector.


A stimulating and collaborative environment, with the opportunity to contribute to shaping the company's future strategies.

title: EGSE & EMC Specialist Engineer
description:
**Position Overview**


The **EGSE \\& EMC Specialist Engineer** is responsible for the **design, validation, and operation** of **Electrical Ground Support Equipment (EGSE)** used for satellite and subsystem testing, as well as for ensuring **Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC)** and **Electrostatic Discharge (ESD)** compliance during spacecraft **integration and test (AIT)** phases.  

The role involves close collaboration with **AIT**, **Systems Engineering**, and **Test** teams to guarantee functional integrity, test accuracy, and compliance with **ESA/NASA** and **ECSS** standards.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* **Design, develop, and validate EGSE systems** (hardware and software) to support satellite functional and environmental testing.
* Plan and perform **EMC/ESD tests, measurements, and analysis to verify compliance** with mission and regulatory requirements.
* Define and implement **test setups, procedures, and instrumentation for integration and qualification campaigns.**
* **Collaborate with AIT teams** during integration, environmental, and functional test activities, providing technical support and troubleshooting.
* Ensure compliance with **ESA/NASA standards, ECSS requirements**, and customer specifications.
* Manage **calibration, maintenance, and documentation of EGSE** and test equipment.
* Support failure investigations and non\\-conformance resolution related to EGSE or EMC performance.
* Contribute to **continuous improvement** of test methodologies, equipment design, and data management.
* Interface with suppliers and external laboratories for **EMC/ESD testing** and validation.

 **Requirements**

* Degree in Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering,or a related technical field.
* Proven **experience in EGSE design, integration, and testing within aerospace** or high\\-reliability environments.
* Expertise in EMC/ESD testing, analysis, and mitigation techniques**.**
* Hands\\-on laboratory experience with measurement instrumentation**, oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers,** and **power systems.**
* Familiarity with **ECSS standards, ESA/NASA testing procedures, and cleanroom operations.**
* Knowledge of satellite subsystems, AIT processes, and electrical interfaces.
* Strong problem\\-solving, analytical, and documentation skills.
* Proficiency in English (written and spoken).
* Possession of a driving license (Category B).

**Nice to Have**

* Experience with hardware/software **EGSE development tools** (e.g. LabVIEW, Python, NI TestStand).
* Knowledge of spacecraft power systems, **TM/TC interfaces**, and test automation.
* Familiarity with electrical safety standards, **ESD control, and HSE requirements**.
* Experience **with EMC simulation tools and RF shielding design.**

**Benefits**

**What We Offer:**

* A dynamic and stimulating work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Metalmeccanico (CCNL) with compensation based on experience and skills.

SPACE INDUSTRIES is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion within its workplace and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or any other characteristic**.**

**Why Join Us?**

A unique opportunity for professional growth in a young and dynamic aerospace company.


The chance to work on innovative projects with a global impact in the small satellite sector.


A stimulating and collaborative environment, with the opportunity to contribute to shaping the company's future strategies.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Italy Software Turin Hybrid
TMC Italia is looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in transforming raw data into valuable insights.

  


About The Member Company
We are a global high\\-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast\\-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high\\-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:


* Technology \\& Engineering
* Energy \\& Renewables
* Life sciences \\& Pharma
* Digital \\& IT
**About this vacancy**
----------------------


* Develop and maintain scalable ETL processes to handle large volumes of data.
* Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to understand data requirements and provide high\\-quality data solutions.
* Optimize data storage and retrieval processes in relational databases, with a focus on Oracle.
* Implement and manage containerized applications using Kubernetes to ensure smooth deployment and orchestration.
* Apply GitOps principles to streamline code deployment and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery.
* Troubleshoot data\\-related issues and ensure data integrity and security.


**What we expect from you**
---------------------------


* MSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or equivalent.
* 2 to 5 years of experience in data engineering or a related field.
* Strong Python programming skills with experience in data handling and ETL processes.
* Familiarity with Kubernetes for container orchestration.
* Understanding of GitOps principles and CI/CD practices.
* Excellent problem\\-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication skills in English and Italian, both written and verbal.
* Serious motivation for the Employeneurship model of TMC.


**What you can expect from us**
-------------------------------


TMC is an international high\\-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.


At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.


As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.


The 5 basic principles of **employeneurship**
A long\\-term working relationship
Enjoy the security of a long\\-term contract and a stable source of income while getting the opportunity to work at diverse projects.


Individual profit sharing
Full transparency. That’s it. For each of your projects, you know your hourly rate, your costs, and your individual performance\\-based profit sharing, all in order to stimulate your inner entrepreneur.


Business cells
Our employeneurs are grouped in business cells based on their technical expertise. They are small, focused and function as high\\-grade knowledge networks. And as buzzing communities of close colleagues.


YOUniversity
Every employeneur drives their own career. Together, we make a plan for personal and professional growth. Receive personal coaching and an extensive training budget to keep developing yourself and deliver outperformance at our clients.

  

The Entrepreneurial Lab
Work on your technical dreams in our lab. Collaborate with others in multidisciplinary teams to unlock out\\-of\\-the\\-box thinking and innovative ideas as well as entrepreneurial skills.
company_description: At TMC we believe it's people who drive technology. Our Employeneurship model creates the best conditions for technical talents to do so.

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
Hey Developer!


Do you want to build digital products that make life easier for people and businesses?  

Etinet is on the lookout for a curious and passionate Full Stack Developer!


**Who we are**  

We’re a young, motivated team with 20\\+ years of experience in Digital Marketing and building tech solutions.  

We partner with both local and national companies on exciting projects ranging from e\\-commerce platforms to SaaS products, always with a focus on innovation and the latest technologies.


By joining Etinet, you’ll be part of the team behind **PingUp**, our in\\-house solution built on the WhatsApp API.  

It’s an innovative product that’s growing every day and is at the core of our digital evolution.

**What you’ll be doing**  

You’ll be the technical driving force behind our digital projects, working across both frontend and backend.  

You’ll collaborate closely with designers, project managers, and fellow developers to create scalable, high\\-performance, and user\\-friendly products.


Your day\\-to\\-day will include:

* Building modern frontend applications with React.js / Next.js (and sometimes just plain vanilla JS).
* Designing and maintaining backend APIs in Node.js, and integrating them with frontends and third\\-party systems.
* Working with relational databases (PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases (MongoDB), handling queries, models, and optimizations.
* Writing clean, maintainable, and performant code.
* Working hand in hand with the design team to turn wireframes and ideas into real products

**What we’re looking for**

* At least 3 years’ experience as a Full Stack Developer.
* Strong skills with React.js and/or Next.js.
* Solid backend experience with Node.js (Express, Nest, or similar).
* Good knowledge of PostgreSQL and MongoDB.
* Someone who writes clean, well\\-documented code, enjoys problem\\-solving, and works well in a team.

**Nice to have**

* Experience with Microsoft Azure (deployments, core services, CI/CD).
* Familiarity with Git and agile workflows.


Don’t worry if you’re not ticking every box — if you’ve got the right attitude and are eager to grow, we’ll support you all the way!

**Why join Etinet?**

* Flexible working hours
* Company laptop
* Hybrid work model (office \\+ remote)
* Tailored training and development
* €8 meal vouchers
* Career growth in a young and dynamic environment
* A stable, full\\-time contract


We’d love to get to know you and your skills! Send us your CV and, if you’ve got personal projects or repos (GitHub, portfolio, etc.), be sure to share them with us.


Workplace and contract details will be agreed with you. If you’re within 50 km of Savigliano or central Turin, even better!

title: LLM Application Engineer (Python) – Full Remote
description:
CGM Consulting cerca **LLM Application Engineer** con esperienza **concreta** nella costruzione di applicazioni basate su **modelli linguistici**: agenti, **RAG**, strumenti/funzioni, valutazione e messa in produzione.

Non cerchiamo “Python generico”: servono **progetti LLM reali** (POC o produzione).

**Modalità \\>\\> Full Remote**

**Requisiti richiesti**

* **Python** in ambito AI applicata (repo o demo pubbliche/portfolio).
* Esperienza **RAG**: pipeline end\\-to\\-end (chunking, retrieval, **vector DB** tipo OpenSearch/Weaviate/Pinecone/pgvector).
* Almeno un framework di orchestrazione: **LangChain** o **LlamaIndex** (tool/function calling).
* Integrazione LLM (OpenAI, Anthropic, Mistral o equivalenti), gestione **token/costi**, **caching** e **rate limits**.
* **Valutazione**: metriche/benchmark (es. **Ragas**, **DeepEval**), dataset di eval e regression testing dei prompt.
* **Guardrail/Safety**: content filtering, PII redaction, policy.
* **Docker** \\+ Git; pratica di **CI/CD**.

**Requisiti preferenziali**

* **OpenSearch** vector \\+ ranking, **Elasticsearch**, **qdrant**.
* **Observability** (traces/log/metrics) per LLM app; monitor costi/latency.
* Basic MLOps/LLMOps (feature store, prompt registry, eval set).

**Mansioni previste**

* Progettare e sviluppare agenti AI e workflow (tool/func calling, multi\\-step).
* Implementare **RAG** robusto (ingestion, retriever tuning, eval).
* Definire suite di **eval automatizzate** e guardrail.
* Hardening per produzione: logging, tracing, cost control, retry/backoff.

**Candidati ora come LLM Application Engineer (Python) – Full Remote.**

**\\>\\> https://cgmconsulting.it/offerta\\-lavoro/llm\\-application\\-engineer\\-python\\-full\\-remote/**

Contratto di lavoro: Tempo pieno, Tempo indeterminato

Retribuzione: €26\\.000,00 \\- €38\\.000,00 all'anno

Benefit:

* Buoni pasto
* Computer aziendale
* Lavoro da casa
company_description: CGM Consulting offre consulenza IT, sviluppo software, trasformazione digitale e soluzioni cloud innovative per aziende, enti pubblici e system integrator.

title: Backend Developer
description:
**Posizione: Backend Developer**

**Località: Torino**

**Tipo di Contratto: Full\\-Time**

**Descrizione dell'Azienda:** siamo una software house di Torino specializzata in sviluppo web, software personalizzato, AI e design. Offriamo un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e innovativo, dove l'eccellenza tecnologica e la creatività sono alla base di tutto ciò che facciamo.

**Descrizione del Ruolo:** stiamo cercando un Backend Developer che si unisca al nostro team. Il candidato ideale ha almeno 2 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo backend e dimestichezza con i framework basati su Javascript e Typescript. Questa è un'opportunità per lavorare su progetti innovativi e contribuire alla crescita tecnologica dell'azienda.

**Responsabilità:**

* Progettare, sviluppare e mantenere applicazioni backend scalabili.
* Collaborare con team di frontend developers, designers e altri stakeholders per definire e implementare nuove funzionalità.
* Garantire l'integrità e la sicurezza dei dati.
* Ottimizzare le performance delle applicazioni.
* Documentare il codice e mantenere aggiornate le specifiche tecniche.
* Partecipare a revisioni di codice e fornire feedback costruttivi.
* Rimanere aggiornato sulle nuove tecnologie e tendenze del settore.

**Requisiti:**

* Almeno 2 anni di esperienza nello sviluppo backend.
* Conoscenza approfondita del framework NodeJS.
* Conoscenza di base del framework frontend Next.
* Buona conoscenza di MongoDB e altri database NoSQL.
* Familiarità con i principi di progettazione di API RESTful.
* Esperienza nella progettazione e implementazione di architetture a microservizi.
* Conoscenza di Docker.
* Sistemi di versioning (Git).
* Comprensione delle pratiche di sicurezza nello sviluppo software.
* Ottime capacità di problem\\-solving e attitudine al lavoro di squadra.
* Esperienza nell’utilizzo di sistemi Linux da linea di comando (shell scripting, gestione processi, configurazione di ambienti di sviluppo e deploy).

**Competenze Aggiuntive (Preferibili ma non Obbligatorie):**

* Familiarità con pipeline di CI/CD.
* Conoscenza di altri database (es. PostgreSQL, MySQL).
* Esperienza in pratiche di DevOps e gestione di ambienti Cloud.

**Cosa Offriamo:**

* Ambiente di lavoro giovane, stimolante e collaborativo.
* Opportunità di crescita professionale.
* Progetti innovativi e sfidanti.
* Formazione continua e aggiornamenti tecnologici.
* Pacchetto retributivo competitivo.
* Uffici locati in un palazzo storico, nel centro di Torino.
* Inquadramento: contratto a tempo indeterminato o apprendistato full\\-time

Siamo impazienti di conoscerti e valutare insieme la possibilità di collaborare

Contratto di lavoro: Tempo pieno

Retribuzione: €1\\.500,00 \\- €2\\.200,00 al mese

Benefit:

* Lavoro da casa
* Orario flessibile
* Supporto allo sviluppo professionale

title: Model Risk Specialist - Internship
description:
Siamo uno dei più grandi gruppi bancari privati e indipendenti italiani che fonda le sue radici in una storia imprenditoriale lunga 450 anni e caratterizzata da innovazione e apertura. Stiamo lavorando per costruire l’ecosistema finanziario sostenibile del futuro con l’obiettivo di contribuire alle sfide personali e imprenditoriali dei nostri clienti.
Il team Risk Models di capogruppo è una squadra fatta di persone sempre pronte a mille sfide; un team di professionisti e professioniste dediti allo sviluppo di nuovi modelli per il presidio e la mitigazione di rischi complessi correlati ad attività e business innovativi.
“*Siamo innovativi per tradizione” e nello sviluppo dei modelli sperimentiamo tecniche nuove e innovative. Se vuoi essere tra coloro che guidano il cambiamento e l’innovazione, unisciti al nostro team!*
Nella nostra squadra avrai l’opportunità di affiancare persone esperte e imparare come sono strutturate tutte le fasi di progettazione del modello: dall’estrazione all’elaborazione dei dati necessari per la costruzione dei campioni di stima; dall’analisi statistica all’uso di tecniche avanzate per la stima di modelli interni, la verifica del loro regolare funzionamento e capacità predittiva (utilizzando SAS oppure Python) fino all’interpretazione e formalizzazione dei risultati ottenuti. Non ti concentrerai su un unico aspetto, ma affiancherai il team nei vari step del processo di sviluppo sia LGD che EAD con finalità AIRB e IFRS9\\. Oltre ciò, sempre con il supporto del team potrai trattare tematiche di modellizzazione di altri eventi relativi a tematiche innovative come il mondo Digital Landing.
IN TE CERCHIAMO:* Un percorso di studi quantitativo in: Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Economia Quantitativa, Finanza o Ingegneria.
* Buone capacità analitiche e conoscenza dei principali test statistici utilizzati per la stima dei modelli.
* Conoscenza degli applicativi: Excel, SAS, Python e SQL. Se non li hai visti tutti, non ti preoccupare li imparerai da noi!
* Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.
* Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning sarà considerata un plus.


PROGETTI INNOVATIVI:* Sviluppo di modelli avanzati per la gestione del rischio di credito utilizzando tecniche di machine learning e intelligenza artificiale.
* Partecipazione a progetti come quello di Digital Landing, esplorando nuove frontiere del settore finanziario digitale.


COSA OFFRIAMO:* Opportunità di apprendere da persone esperte e di crescere professionalmente in un ambiente stimolante e innovativo;
* Collaborazione con team multidisciplinari per creare soluzioni innovative che rispondano alle esigenze dei nostri clienti e del mercato.
* Formazione continua e accesso a risorse per lo sviluppo delle tue competenze;
* Ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e collaborativo, dove le tue idee e il tuo contributo sono valorizzati;
* Stage formativo curricolare o extracurricolare di 6 mesi;
* Rimborso spese 800€ mensili;
* Data inserimento: Gennaio 2026


Modalità e sede di lavoro: presenza fisica a Biella*Il gruppo Sella promuove un ambiente di lavoro sostenibile, inclusivo e che abbraccia le diversità di genere, età, nazionalità, come occasione di continuo scambio culturale e fattore determinante per lo sviluppo stesso dell’ecosistema di Gruppo*.

title: Full Stack Developer .NET
description:
NTWK, azienda italiana operante nella ricerca e selezione del personale, si occupa di soddisfare le necessità dei clienti offrendo servizi personalizzati.

  

  

**Posizione:**
--------------

**CHI CERCHIAMO:**


Siamo alla ricerca di un **Full Stack Developer** da inserire all’interno della nostra **Area Automation**.  

  



La figura farà parte di un Team di sviluppo per l’evoluzione di sistemi complessi in ambito gestionale e la realizzazione di funzionalità innovative per i nostri clienti. Facendo riferimento al proprio Team Leader e seguendo un processo ben strutturato, la figura ricercata dovrà seguire la progettazione, lo sviluppo ed il test degli interventi assegnati e la manutenzione dei moduli della suite.

 **SI OCCUPERÀ DI:**


Progettazione e sviluppo di componenti di front\\-end e back\\-end seguendo le specifiche funzionali e proponendo le soluzioni che meglio si adattano alle esigenze del progetto e del prodotto;

* Verifica della qualità del codice e progettazione/esecuzione di unit test;
* Progettazione e sviluppo di strutture dati su database relazionali;
* Relazionarsi con il cliente per la definizione e l’implementazione delle soluzioni e delle funzionalità richieste;
* Eseguire un’analisi sulla base delle richieste del cliente, sviluppare quanto analizzato e partecipare alla fase di collaudo.

--------------

**REQUISITI:**

* Laurea in Informatica o Diploma tecnico con esperienza nel ruolo di almeno 2 anni;
* Esperienza nella programmazione .NET e/o .NET Core
* Conoscenza di C\\#, ASP.NET MVC o JavaSCRIPt
* Esperienza nella progettazione e sviluppo di servizi RESTful e API Web
* Esperienza sui database relazionali Microsoft SQL Server Oracle, MySql,etc;
* Esperienza nella realizzazione di applicazioni Android;
* Conoscenza della lingua italiana (B2\\) – inglese (B2\\)
* Conoscenza ed utilizzo del sistema di versioning Git

**Altre informazioni:**
-----------------------

**CONTESTO ORGANIZZATIVO**


La risorsa sarà inserita nel team che si occupa della gestione, implementazione ed evoluzione dei prodotti software realizzati dall’azienda


Nell’ambito della mansione riporterà gerarchicamente e funzionalmente al referente del progetto.

 **SEDE DI LAVORO:**


Biella con possibili trasferte sul territorio

 **ORARIO DI LAVORO**


Full time

title: Java Developer
description:

Attraverso i suoi marchi \\- Alpitour, Bravo, Francorosso, Eden Viaggi e Turisanda \\- rappresenta la divisione Tour Operating di Alpitour World e si rivolge ai segmenti B2B e B2C,* portando in vacanza oltre 1 milione di italiani ogni anno.*. **Posizione:**
--------------

  

La risorsa, presso la sede di **Torino**, si dovrà occupare della gestione ed implementazione delle soluzioni applicative in ambito web\\-Java ottimizzando e manutenendo applicativi backend (Java 8\\-11\\) e/o frontend (React \\- Angular).

  

L'inserimento avverrà all’interno dell’area Software Factory presso la sede di Torino all'interno dei team dedicati ad una specifica linea di Business (Es. pricing, vendite, prenotazioni, pagamenti, tool kit, capacity, etc..).

Il presente annuncio è rivolto a tutte le persone, indipendentemente da genere, età, origine etnica, nazionalità, orientamento sessuale, identità di genere, disabilità o qualsiasi altra caratteristica personale, in conformità con le normative vigenti in materia di pari opportunità e inclusione (D.Lgs. 198/2006 e successive modifiche, D.Lgs. 215/03 e 216/03\\).

title: Frontend Developer
description:
***Realizza le tue aspirazioni professionali ed entra a far parte del mondo Zucchetti!***

 ***www.zucchetti.it***

  

  

**Posizione:**
--------------

Per la nostra sede di Torino siamo alla ricerca di risorse da inserire come Frontend Developer.

**Il team:**


Le figure entreranno a far parte del team di produzione della divisione dedicata al software Intiway.

**Ruolo:**


Le risorse saranno dedicate allo sviluppo con un focus sulla parte front\\-end. Saranno coinvolte nel processo di sviluppo e test del prodotto nel rispetto dei requisiti funzionali attesi per lo sviluppo di nuove features. Gestiranno la fase evolutiva e manutentiva del software scrivendo codice pulito, sicuro e documentato. Ricerchiamo risorse appassionate, caratterizzate da interesse per gli aggiornamenti tecnologici applicati allo sviluppo e alle architetture software in scenari di lavoro mutevoli.

**Obiettivo:**


L’obiettivo sarà quello di sviluppare ed implementare un codice efficiente e di alta qualità e contribuire al miglioramento delle soluzioni con nuove tecnologie.

**Requisiti:**
--------------

* Diploma o Laurea in Informatica e/o affini;
* Ottima conoscenza HTML5 e CSS3;
* Ottima conoscenza della programmazione JavaScript / TypeScript;
* Ottima conoscenza di React
* Gradita conoscenza di Vue.JS e/o React e/o Angular;
* Conoscenza di RESTful APIs;
* Conoscenza di Git;
* Desiderio di mantenersi all'avanguardia sugli ultimi sviluppi di tecnologie, coding trends e best practices per il Frontend.

  

Ricerchiamo risorse con ottime capacità di lavorare in team e per obiettivi, in grado di gestire con responsabilità i progetti; importanti inoltre entusiasmo, voglia mettersi in gioco e flessibilità.

**Altre informazioni:**
-----------------------

Ti offriamo:

* **Hybrid Work**. Lavoriamo in maniera ibrida: in parte presso la sede, prenotando la nostra postazione, e in parte in smart working. Ti verrà quindi fornito il necessario (*Tech Pack*) per lavorare al meglio in ufficio o quando sei a casa!
* **Continuo Digital Training**. Grazie alle nostre piattaforme online potrai seguire corsi e approfondimenti delle tematiche che più ti appassionano della tua area professionale.
* **People Care**. Tutto per il benessere, la famiglia e il tempo libero, tuo e dei tuoi famigliari. Questo il piano di benefit esclusivi e agevolazioni che proponiamo ai nostri collaboratori e collaboratrici, insieme al Language Lab (per ottimizzare le tue abilità di comunicazione in lingua straniera) e Fitprime (con tante iniziative a promozione della salute e del benessere).
* **Career Path**. La voglia di crescere, le opportunità organizzative, un buon livello di professionalità e una forte motivazione sono la ricetta giusta per accedere ad action plan personalizzati!
* **Sustainability Culture**. Una cultura che si ispira agli Obiettivi di Sviluppo Sostenibile promossi dalle Nazioni Unite, orientata alla conciliazione vita privata – lavoro, rispetto delle diversità e dei diritti umani, salute e sicurezza nei luoghi di lavoro, lotta alla corruzione e benessere organizzativo, senza dimenticare l’attenzione alla sostenibilità ambientale, economica e sociale.
* **Diversity\\&Inclusion.** *La diversità è un dato di fatto, l’inclusione è una scelta* (Verna Myers) e noi abbiamo scelto di creare un ambiente inclusivo dove ogni persona è rispettata, valorizzata e incoraggiata ad esprimere sè stessa e le proprie opinioni.


Le persone sono il centro della nostra azienda e riconosciamo competenze ma anche inclinazioni, caratteristiche, orientamenti e approcci diversi alla realtà che conﬂuiscono nel contesto organizzativo e lo rendono creativo, innovativo e performante.

  

Vuoi scoprire come si lavora in Zucchetti? Seguici su Instagram e metti Mi Piace alla nostra pagina Facebook!

 **\\#BeZucchetti**

 *Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03\\.*
