La figura entrerà a far parte del team di produzione della divisione dedicata al software Intiway.

**Ruolo:**


La risorsa che verrà inserita come Backend Developer parteciperà alla progettazione e allo sviluppo di nuove funzionalità per il software. Le attività saranno inoltre quelle di sviluppo backend e di microservizi, scrittura di unit\\-test e feature\\-test, analisi e ottimizzazione della performance.

**Obiettivo:**


L’obiettivo sarà contribuire alla crescita del prodotto scrivendo codice pulito, sicuro, documentato e testato per garantire una soluzione software di alta qualità.

  

**Requisiti:**
--------------

* Diploma o Laurea in Informatica e/o affini;
* Esperienza pregressa di sviluppo Java Backend di almeno due anni;
* Conoscenza di Java, SQL e database relazionali;
* Sviluppo di web Service RestFul;
* Conoscenza dei framework: Spring, Spring Boot;
* Conoscenza di Maven, Git, Subversion;
* Gradita esperienza di sviluppo applicazioni con architettura a servizi e microservizi;
* Esperienza in utilizzo di Container (Docker, Kubernetes) e di Message Queue (esempio Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ, ecc).




Ricerchiamo risorse con ottime capacità di lavorare in team e per obiettivi, in grado di gestire con responsabilità i progetti; importanti inoltre entusiasmo, voglia mettersi in gioco e flessibilità.

  



  

**Altre informazioni:**
-----------------------

Ti offriamo:

* **Hybrid Work**. Lavoriamo in maniera ibrida: in parte presso la sede, prenotando la nostra postazione, e in parte in smart working. Ti verrà quindi fornito il necessario (*Tech Pack*) per lavorare al meglio in ufficio o quando sei a casa!
* **Continuo Digital Training**. Grazie alle nostre piattaforme online potrai seguire corsi e approfondimenti delle tematiche che più ti appassionano della tua area professionale.
* **People Care**. Tutto per il benessere, la famiglia e il tempo libero, tuo e dei tuoi famigliari. Questo il piano di benefit esclusivi e agevolazioni che proponiamo ai nostri collaboratori e collaboratrici, insieme al Language Lab (per ottimizzare le tue abilità di comunicazione in lingua straniera) e Fitprime (con tante iniziative a promozione della salute e del benessere).
* **Career Path**. La voglia di crescere, le opportunità organizzative, un buon livello di professionalità e una forte motivazione sono la ricetta giusta per accedere ad action plan personalizzati!
* **Sustainability Culture**. Una cultura che si ispira agli Obiettivi di Sviluppo Sostenibile promossi dalle Nazioni Unite, orientata alla conciliazione vita privata – lavoro, rispetto delle diversità e dei diritti umani, salute e sicurezza nei luoghi di lavoro, lotta alla corruzione e benessere organizzativo, senza dimenticare l’attenzione alla sostenibilità ambientale, economica e sociale.
* **Diversity\\&Inclusion.** *La diversità è un dato di fatto, l’inclusione è una scelta* (Verna Myers) e noi abbiamo scelto di creare un ambiente inclusivo dove ogni persona è rispettata, valorizzata e incoraggiata ad esprimere sè stessa e le proprie opinioni.


Le persone sono il centro della nostra azienda e riconosciamo competenze ma anche inclinazioni, caratteristiche, orientamenti e approcci diversi alla realtà che conﬂuiscono nel contesto organizzativo e lo rendono creativo, innovativo e performante.

  

Vuoi scoprire come si lavora in Zucchetti? Seguici su Instagram e metti Mi Piace alla nostra pagina Facebook!

 **\\#BeZucchetti**

 *Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03\\.*

title: Administration Manager
description:
**Job Overview:**
 The Administrative Manager is the key figure for controlling and planning the company's financial resources, preparing financial statements, and overseeing tax, accounting, and reporting activities. They will play a crucial role in business decision\\-making, managing the budget, cash flow, and daily operations.
   

  

**Role and Responsibilities:**
 The Administration Manager will be responsible for managing and developing all administrative and management activities within the company, starting from scratch and building an administrative team. Their main responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Business Management Implementation
* Coordination and supervision of accounting and tax activities, ensuring proper recording of transactions and compliance with fiscal and corporate regulations
* Management of administrative documentation, including contracts, invoices, financial statements, and reports
* General Accounting (recording of accounts receivable from domestic and international clients, recording of accounts payable invoices with corresponding supplier order checks), bank reconciliations, cash management
* Support in preparing adjusting entries for the preparation of periodic reporting, including managing closures and balancing accounts for both financial and managerial accounting
* Creation and implementation of standardized administrative and management procedures to support the company's growth
* Collaboration with management for financial planning and cash flow management, including the preparation of budgets and forecasts
* Supervision and management of company logistics, including orders and material purchases
* Management of reporting activities and communication with international partners


**Requirements**
* Degree in Management Engineering, Administration and Finance, Economics, Law, or similar fields
* At least 3\\-5 years of experience in administrative and managerial roles, preferably in medium\\-to\\-large companies or in an international setting
* Excellent proficiency in English (both spoken and written)
* Strong proficiency with computer tools, particularly Excel and accounting management software
* Autonomy and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
* Strong organizational and problem\\-solving skills
* Flexibility, dynamism, and the ability to adapt to a constantly evolving work environment


**Benefits**
**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and stimulating work environment.
* Opportunities for growth and professional development.
* Employment contract with compensation commensurate with experience and skills
* Metalmeccanico (CCNL) with compensation based on experience and skills.


 SPACE INDUSTRIES is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion in its workplace and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or any other characteristic.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
* A unique opportunity for professional growth in a young and dynamic company in the aerospace sector.
* The chance to work on innovative projects with a global impact in the small satellite industry.
* A stimulating and collaborative environment, with the opportunity to contribute to shaping the company's future strategies

title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
description:
**Company Overview:**
 Space Industries is an innovative and fast\\-growing company specializing in the design, development, and integration of cutting\\-edge solutions for micro, small, and nano satellites. With a passion for technological advancement and a vision to redefine the future of space exploration, we are committed to providing advanced satellite systems that will have a global impact. As part of our ambitious growth strategy, we are looking for a dynamic
 **Chief Technology Officer (CTO)** 
 to lead and drive our technology vision, strategy, and innovation.
   

  

**Position Overview:**
 As the
 **CTO** 
 at Space Industries, you will play a key role in shaping and executing the company's technology strategy. You will oversee the entire technological development and execution process for our satellite programs, leading a talented team of engineers and working closely with the executive team to ensure that Space Industries remains at the forefront of the space industry. Your leadership will be crucial in ensuring the success of our satellite missions and will involve managing technology roadmaps, partnerships, and ensuring the seamless integration of technology into our operational processes.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Technology Strategy \\& Leadership: Develop and execute the company's technology vision and strategy aligned with business goals, ensuring Space Industries remains a leader in the space satellite sector.
* Innovation Management: Oversee the innovation of new technologies related to satellite systems, including propulsion, payload integration, communications, and on\\-board systems.
* Team Leadership: Build and lead a high\\-performance engineering team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and technical excellence. Guide team members to deliver cutting\\-edge solutions in satellite development
* Satellite System Development: Drive the technical direction of micro, small, and nano satellites, ensuring that our technology roadmap is aligned with current industry trends and market demands.
* Research \\& Development: Manage and oversee research and development efforts to continually push the boundaries of satellite technology, with a focus on scalability, reliability, and cost\\-effectiveness.
* Cross\\-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with other departments such as Operations, Product Development, Marketing, and Business Development to integrate technology solutions into the business operations
* Technology Integration: Oversee the integration of new technologies and platforms, ensuring smooth execution and coordination between internal teams and external partners.
* Quality Assurance: Implement best practices for technology development and ensure that all products and systems meet the highest standards of quality and compliance with industry regulations.
* Risk Management: Identify technological risks, develop mitigation strategies, and oversee the resolution of any technical challenges that may arise during the development lifecycle
* Partnerships \\& Alliances: Foster relationships with strategic technology partners, external vendors, and academic institutions to stay ahead of emerging trends and innovations in the space industry.
* Board \\& Executive Reporting: Provide regular updates on technology progress, challenges, and solutions to the Board of Directors and senior executives.


**Requirements**
* Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Experience: At least 5\\+ years of experience in technology leadership roles, preferably in the aerospace or satellite industry, with a strong background in satellite technology.
* Possess exceptional expertise in designing and system engineering for satellites, satellite constellations, and the most advanced space systems, especially those related to complex missions
* Proven Leadership: Demonstrated experience in leading technology teams, driving innovation, and managing complex technical projects from inception through to successful execution.
* Deep Understanding of Satellite Systems: In\\-depth knowledge of micro, small, and nano satellite design, integration, and operations, including propulsion systems, payloads, power management, and communication technologies.
* Strategic Thinking: Strong ability to think strategically about technology investments, emerging trends, and long\\-term R\\&D plans
* Strong Communication Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and inspire internal teams and external stakeholders.
* Problem\\-Solving \\& Decision\\-Making: Exceptional problem\\-solving abilities and the capacity to make critical decisions under pressure.
* Fluency in English (oral and written) is required. Additional languages are a plus
* Possession of a driving license (Category B).


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience with NewSpace startups or organizations focused on small satellite technologies.
* Knowledge of space regulatory requirements and industry standards (e.g., ECSS, NASA, ISO).
* Previous experience in managing R\\&D budgets, technology partnerships, and product development pipelines.
* Familiarity with space mission lifecycle, from concept design to deployment and operations


**Benefits**
**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and stimulating work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Metalmeccanico (CCNL) with compensation based on experience and skills.


 SPACE INDUSTRIES is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion within its workplace and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or any other characteristic
 **.**
**Why Join Us?**
 A unique opportunity for professional growth in a young and dynamic aerospace company.
   

  

 The chance to work on innovative projects with a global impact in the small satellite sector.
   

  

 A stimulating and collaborative environment, with the opportunity to contribute to shaping the company's future strategies.

title: Business Development Expert – Europe
description:
**Overall Job Description** 




 The Business Development Expert (mostly Secure Identity), will support the company’s development in secure identity technologies and applications. She/he will be the front of the company and will have the dedication to create and apply an effective Go\\-To\\-Market strategy that drives sustainable financial growth in secure identity segment through boosting sales and forging strong relationships with clients.
 



 The BDE is expected to develop effective relationships with clients and partners to encourage new and repeat business opportunities for the Secure Identity offering.
 



  





**Major Job Responsibilities** 



* Understand and define customer needs.
* Actively participate with marketing and product management in the development and creation of Secure Identity products/programs/platforms; creation of demand and preference for Matica Group Secure Identity solution offerings and a broadening of group position in targeted accounts and channel partners through the sale and promotion of Secure Identity solutions.
* Work closely with the Marketing and Sales teams and acquire familiarity with R\\&D and Global Services areas, and interact on a regular basis with: Customers (end users), Technology partners (ISVs, vendors – namely in the secure identity space), Commercial partners (distributors, resellers), Industry players (associations, media, analysts \\& consultants, etc.) in order to:
* Secure client commitment and revenue generation for Matica Group’s Secure Identity solutions
* Define and develop a growth strategy in Secure identity space focused both on financial gain and customer satisfaction
* Gather useful information from customers and competitors to improve \\& fine\\-tune Matica’s secure identity solution offering to ensure rapid success in the market.
* Review current trends and propose new business ideas to improve revenue in the Secure Identity market
* Identify key commercial and/or technology partnerships to allow success in the identified markets.
* Develop and maintain relationships with the identified partner(s)
* Coordinate with current sales teams to develop targeted proposals
* Produce and deliver presentations to prospective clients, partners, and internal executives
* Contribute to improving company visibility in the secure identity space
* Offer support to lead generation initiatives, campaigns, event participation
* Be available as a speaker or panellist for the company on security\\-related themes
* Report periodically on the status of business development activities.
* Analyze our reseller footprint on core business operations and suggest possible improvements by identifying and negotiating with potential new partners.



  





**Knowledge and Skills** 




**General** 



* General knowledge of marketing strategies, mix, and tactics
* Engagement skills with customers, commercial partners, technology partners, industry organizations
* Negotiation and Sales skills
* Demonstrable written and oral communication and presentation skills
* Good communication skills
* General information technology concepts and computer skills
* Strong work ethic
* Collaboration and relationship\\-building with multiple internal functions
* Mandatory fluency in English; preferred one or more Latin languages
* Social media active
* Excellent time management and organizational abilities
* The ability to work independently across multiple markets in Europe and channels, understand local differences and adapt to varying time zones and geographies will be required.



  





**Position\\-Specifics** 



* Undergraduate degree in marketing and/or management and/or technical
* 2\\-3 years of business development experience, preferably in SaaS business
* Business Canvas Model or other Strategic Management tool knowledge
* Solid security technologies background, namely in identity verification \\& authentication
* Biometrics, Healthcare, Hospitality or Banking background preferred
* General Technical hardware, software, and infrastructure knowledge
* Analytics and results measurement (SalesForce, BI, other dashboards)
* Business case and financial analysis (including ROI and IRR)
* The position will be based in Turin, Italy. 70% percent travel.



  





**About Matica** 




 Matica is a global leader in secure ID issuance and financial card personalization solutions. With innovative hardware, software, and services, we provide high\\-quality and scalable solutions to banks, government agencies, and enterprises worldwide.
 



  





**Why Join Us** 



* Be part of an innovative, growing team building next generation solutions for the Secure ID and Payment sector
* Work in a fast paced, collaborative and agile environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.

title: Junior Engineer
Demand Planner
description:
**Job Summary:** 




  





 We are looking for experienced demand / supply planners, combining strong operational execution skills and strategic vision for our Supply Chain
 **spare parts activity** 
 . The ideal candidate, in addition to the planning of some specific product lines, should be able to take the lead on some transverse processes and challenge them to introduce breakthroughs in our operations. You will possess a keen ability to
 **analyse customer demand** 
 to develop and fine tune forecasts. The Demand Planner’s responsibilities include reviewing purchase history, sales history, marketing promotion products and stimulate growth or pick and, ultimately, evaluating their effectiveness and challenge data and processes.
 



 You will contribute establishing a
 **demand driven** 
 and
 **collaborative planning** 
 with our customers, exploiting our Distributors’ sell\\-out data. Highly
 **analytical** 
 you demonstrate deep knowledge of
 **advanced mathematical** 
 and
 **forecasting policies** 
 , as well as a good end\\-to\\-end knowledge of the
 **Supply Chain activities** 
 .
 



 In addition, strong
 **communication** 
 and
 **stakeholder engagement** 
 are critical to success in this role, which includes the ability to effectively partner and collaborate with those leading and working on the commercial side of the business i.e. sales, marketing and related.
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Analyse and question the results of
 **forecast** 
 calculated by the statistical model implements solutions to improve the
 **accuracy** 
 of
 **demand forecasting** 
 .
* Meet with other functional area managers as Sales, Marketing, Customers, Finance and Supply Chain operations (e.g. Warehouse, transport…) to
 **review strategies** 
 related to both short\\- and long\\-term planning.
* Propose and implement solutions to improve
 **demand forecast accuracy.**
* Successfully communicate
 **forecast** 
 and
 **inventory estimations** 
 to the involved stakeholders (e.g. warehouse, transportation, supply planning, supplier relationship management, ….).
* Monitor and report on important changes in sales forecasts, budgets and business strategies comparing
 **statistical forecast** 
 with real demand summed with the commercial campaigns.
* Support management with
 **risk assessments** 
 and
 **mitigation activities** 
 .
* Address
 **demand\\-related issues** 
 in a timely and effective manner.
* Assist in developing annual
 **budgets.**
* Schedule regular
 **demand review meetings** 
 with management and other stakeholders involved in the process.
* Work with team members to plan, coordinate, and execute
 **demand planning activities.**
* Coordinate with inventory management team to monitor and maintain
 **optimal inventory levels.**
* Maintain
 **training materials** 
 and organize trainings to team members.



  





  





**Skills, Attributes \\& Requirements:** 




  




* Strong
 **commercial and financial awareness** 
 , understanding the impact of failures on costs (e.g., excess stock, warehouse space) and customer order fulfillment.
* Deep knowledge of
 **supply chain processes** 
 at regional and global levels, including
 **purchasing, logistics, demand planning, statistical forecasting, and inventory management** 
 .
* Proficiency in
 **ERP systems** 
 ,
 **data analysis** 
 ,
 **report development** 
 , and Microsoft Office tools.
* Excellent
 **communication, negotiation, and leadership skills** 
 , with the ability to engage teams and maintain strong business relationships.
* **Analytical mindset** 
 with expertise in
 **forecasting and problem\\-solving** 
 , ensuring a structured yet agile approach.
* **Resilient and results\\-driven** 
 , capable of managing conflicts and working effectively under pressure.
* **Fluent in English** 
 , with the ability to independently manage meetings and reports; knowledge of an additional
 **European language** 
 (ideally Italian or French) is a plus.
* **Master’s degree** 
 in
 **Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration,** 
 or a related field.
* **5 to 10 years of experience** 
 in
 **supply planning management** 
 within
 **manufacturing or retail industries** 
 (e.g., FMCG, industrial products, automotive).



  





  





 At Stellantis, we assess candidates based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, age, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sexual orientation and disability.
 



 Diverse teams, will allow us to better meet the evolving needs of our customers and care for our future.
 



  





 By submitting your application, you are accepting our privacy notice: https://www.stellantis.com/en/privacy

title: N. 1 IMPIEGATO / A UFFICIO COMMERCIALE
description:
Etjca S.p.a.
   

  

 Il nostro cliente è una prestigiosa Azienda operante nel settore servizi e ci ha incaricati della selezione di:
   

  

**N. 1 IMPIEGATO /A UFFICIO COMMERCIALE**
 La risorsa sarà inserita all'interno dell'Ufficio Commerciale e potrà essere responsabile della gestione autonoma di un nuovo punto vendita, occupandosi delle attività di front\\-office e della relazione diretta con il cliente.
   

  

 Si occuperà di:
   

  

**Ruolo e Responsabilità** 
 :
   

  

* Gestione operativa e amministrativa del punto vendita
* Accoglienza e assistenza clienti (sportello/front office)
* Supporto nella gestione delle pratiche commerciali e contrattuali
* Collaborazione con le altre funzioni aziendali per garantire un servizio efficiente
* Gestione della reportistica commerciale


**Riporto gerarchico: Responsabile commerciale**

 :
   

  

* Diploma superiore o laurea in ambito scientifico
* Esperienza pregressa nella gestione autonoma di un punto vendita in ambito commodities energetiche
* Ottime capacità relazionali e di gestione del cliente

 Casale Monferrato

 : contratto a tempo determinato con inquadramento al 1 o al 2 livello del CCNL GAS\\-Acqua Utilitalia a seconda dell'esperienza e delle competenze del candidato selezionato.
   

  

**Procedura di selezione**
 I candidati selezionati saranno convocati per un primo colloquio conoscitivo al superamento del quale verranno sottoposti ad una prova pratica e scritta. La rosa di candidati idonei a seguito delle prove sarà sottoposta a colloquio finale con la Direzione. Al termine della procedura selettiva, la commissione esaminatrice pubblicherà sul sito internet istituzionale nella sezione "società trasparente" sottosezione "selezione del personale" la graduatoria finale. Tale graduatoria avrà un durata pari a 3 mesi.
   

  

 L'offerta è rivolta a candidati ambosessi nel rispetto del D.lgs 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii. e dei Decreti legislativi n. 215 e 216 del 2003 sulla parità di trattamento. Si invitano i candidati a prendere visione dell'informativa privacy https://etjca.it/informativa\\-per\\-candidati (art.13 e 14, Reg EU 679/2016\\) pubblicata sul sito www.etjca.it.

title: Analista Data Governance
description:
NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, è tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services.
   

  

 Con più di 140\\.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicità, talento ed attitudine.
   

  

 Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, l’ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra priorità. Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunità e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.
   

  

 Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!
   

  

 www.nttdata.com/it
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Il candidato scelto sarà inserito all'interno del Center Of Excellence Informatica parte della practice “Data Intelligence” di NTT DATA Italia.
   

  

 Un analista della governance dei dati è specializzato nella gestione dei flussi di informazioni incluse l'integrità, l'efficienza e la disponibilità dei dati. Avrà in compito di confrontarsi con il cliente e gli stakeholder di progetto al fine di indirizzare le giuste scelte tecnologiche e di business in modo da rendere fruibili, validi e facilmente consultabili i dati aziendali. Sarà premiante la conoscenza dell’intera suite di Data Governance dei principali vendor con particolare attenzione alla suite Informatica, ivi compresa la componente di Master Data Management.
   

  

**Rientrano Nei Suoi Compiti**
* Analisi dell’ecosistema del cliente, delle best practice e dei modelli di governance in uso;
* Analisi dei flussi dei dati tra sistemi;
* Supporto al disegno dei flussi tramite soluzioni Informatica, delle regole di qualità e della definizione del Business Glossary e del suo popolamento attraverso gli strumenti di catalogazione, come:
* Informatica Axon
* Informatica Enterprise Data Catalog (EDC)
* Informatica MDM


**Required Skills**
* Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche.
* Esperienza di almeno 3 anni nell’ambito di Data Governance.
* Profonda conoscenza dei principali strumenti della suite Informatica Axon, EDC, MDM.


**Completano Il Profilo**
* Conoscenza di altri prodotti di Data Governance quali Collibra Governance, Talend Data Management Platform, SAS Data Management, etc..
* Capacità di stesura della documentazione in lingua inglese.
* Esperienze progettuali con in principali Cloud Provider (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM Cloud)


 Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino
   

  

**﻿ Third parties fraudulently posing as NTT DATA recruiters**
 NTT DATA recruiters will never ask job seekers and candidates for payment or banking information during the recruitment process, for any reason. Please remain vigilant of third parties that may try to impersonate NTT DATA recruiters, either in writing or by phone, in an attempt to deceptively obtain personal data or money from you. All email communications from an NTT DATA recruiter will be associated with an @ email address. NTT DATA will not use any non\\-NTT DATA or personal email domains (Gmail, Yahoo, etc.) or personal communication channels (WhatsApp, Facebook etc) at any time during the recruitment process. If you suspect any fraudulent activity, please .

title: Key Account Manager
job_function: Distribution, Supply Chain, and Customer Service
description:
**It's more than a job**
 With a sales career at Kuehne\\+Nagel, you'll drive long\\-term business success by mastering sales strategies, nurturing customer relationships and identifying new opportunities. But you will also bring relief and peace of mind to pet owners around the world. Because when you do your job, your colleagues around the world are able to build reliable veterinary supply chains that ensure pets get the care they need. At Kuehne\\+Nagel, our work is about more than we imagine.
   

  

 ‎
   

  

 At Kuehne\\+Nagel we are looking for a Key Account Manager for the Road Logistics function with headquarters in Milan or Turin who will take charge of the management of customers in the North\\-West area.
   

  

 The Key Account Manager Road Logistics works within the Road Logistics Function. The Road Logistics in Kuehne\\+Nagel is a fundamental asset and provides Road shipping and Road forwarding solutions to achieve customer performance goals.
   

  

 As Key Account Manager you will be the primary point of contact of the customers belonging to the assigned area, driving the implementation of the business development strategy in alignment with the National Road Logistics Sales Manager and you will monitor the service level to ensure customer excellence.
   

  

**How you create impact**
* Contribute to the identification of new opportunitites to improve the footprint of business and solutions with customers from the assigned area, ensuring an attractive and sizeable pipeline, and high closing ratio and collaborate and partner with our the other business units to deliver attractive pricing and service.
* Develop and execute Key Account strategy, defining strategic approach on value proposition and solution, as well as the internal and external positions of Kuehne\\+Nagel on RFQs and tenders and be in charge of customer relationship, being the primary point of contact across the customer engagement cycle to facilitate a partnership relationship with assigne customers, by understanding the organization and decision\\-making process specific needs.
* Oversee the transition of new business into operations and control monthly performance, monitoring volume, profitability, pipeline, overdues, and ensuring immediate actions in case of deviations (i.e. timeliness/accurate reporting).


**What we would like you to bring**
* At least five years’ experience in Project Management, with hands\\-on experience
* At least five years’ experience with sales and portfolio management and performance analysis
* Operational knowledge of Finance and experience with stakeholder management
* Proficiency with relevant systems/tools and Advanced level Excel applications
* A Bachelors’ degree in Business Administration, Economics or a related field
* Advanced in English


**What's in it for you**
 There has never been a better time to work in logistics. Bring your skills to an industry that offers stability and career growth. We offer a great compensation, an interesting work environment and plenty of benefits, including 24/7 accident insurance and permanent disability, supplementary medical expense refund, welfare plan, remote working and much more.
   

  

**Who we are**
 Logistics shapes everyday life \\- from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne\\+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.
   

  

 As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life\\-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.
   

  

 We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: CAPO PARTITA SVIZZERA
job_function: General Business, Management, and Business Development
description:
CHEF DE PARTIE
   

  

 Benvenuti nel mondo Luigia, dove la passione per la cucina italiana incontra l'energia vibrante della Svizzera! Siamo un gruppo di ristoranti italiani rinomati, con 12 location nelle principali città svizzere, 2 in Italia e un franchising a Dubai, che offre non solo piatti deliziosi, ma anche esperienze indimenticabili!
   

  

  

  

 Sogni di lavorare in un ambiente dove ogni piatto racconta una storia e ogni membro del team è un protagonista?
   

  

  

  

 Stiamo cercando nuovi Chef de partie per far parte della nostra famiglia
   

  

  

  

 Perché Luigia?
   

  

  

  

 Un'Atmosfera Unica: Immagina di lavorare in un ambiente dove il calore del sole italiano incontra l'innovazione svizzera. Ogni giorno è un'opportunità per creare, crescere e splendere!
   

  

  

  

 Condizioni di Lavoro Attraenti: Contratto a tempo indeterminato, 2 giorni di riposo a settimana, 5 settimane di ferie retribuite all'anno e un salario competitivo con possibilità di crescita.
   

  

  

  

 Sostenibilità al Centro: Da Luigia, siamo fieri del nostro impegno verso pratiche sostenibili. Utilizziamo ingredienti selezionati e riduciamo al minimo il nostro impatto ambientale. Con noi, cucini per il futuro del pianeta.
   

  

  

  

 ‍‍‍ Inclusività e Diversità: Crediamo che le migliori idee nascano dalla diversità. Da Luigia, accogliamo e celebriamo ogni persona, creando un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e stimolante.
   

  

  

  

 Benefici Straordinari:
   

  

  

  

 Mobilità Intelligente: Bonus per il trasporto sostenibile.
   

  

 Bonus Bebè: Sostegno per la tua famiglia.
   

  

 Supporto Completo per il Trasferimento: Assistenza per pratiche amministrative e per la ricerca di alloggio se vieni dall'estero.
   

  

 Crescita e Sviluppo: Formazione continua e opportunità di carriera senza limiti.
   

  

  

  

  

  

 Il Tuo Ruolo da Protagonista:
   

  

  

  

 ‍ Chef de partie: Cerchiamo uno Chef de partie con almeno 3 anni di esperienza e una profonda conoscenza della cucina italiana tradizionale.
   

  

  

  

 ️ Lingue: Italiano fluente.
   

  

  

  

 ⌛ Disponibilità: Immediata, pronto a lanciarti nella nostra avventura.
   

  

  

  

 Qualità Personali: Spirito intraprendente, convivialità e una curiosità insaziabile.
   

  

  

  

 Vivi un Giorno da protagonista in uno dei ristoranti Luigia:
   

  

  

  

 Ti diamo l'opportunità di sperimentare il nostro mondo con un'esperienza retribuita di 3 giorni. Incontrerai il nostro team straordinario, scoprirai i segreti della nostra cucina e sentirai la magia di Luigia.
   

  

  

  

 Allora, sei pronto a trasformare la tua carriera in un'esperienza unica? Invia subito il tuo CV, non vediamo l'ora di accoglierti nella grande famiglia Luigia!
   

  

  

  

 N.B.: Accettiamo solo candidature per posizioni a tempo pieno e a lungo termine. No a lavori stagionali.

title: AIT Technician
description:
**Company Overview:**
 SPACE INDUSTRIES is a dynamic and rapidly growing company in the aerospace sector, with a strong commitment to innovation and excellence. We are looking for an
 **AIT Technician** 
 to join our team and support the company's daily operations, focusing on assembly, integration, and testing (AIT) of satellites, particularly small satellites.
   

  

**Position Overview:**
 We are seeking a motivated
 **Assembly, Integration, and Testing (AIT) Technician** 
 to join our Space Laboratory in Settimo Torinese. As an aerospace technician, the candidate will become part of a collaborative team to perform AIT activities, including mechanical and electrical assembly, integration, wiring production, and facilitating performance testing at both the satellite component subsystem level and the system level.
   

  

**Responsibilities include:**
* Perform receipt inspection, preparation (kitting), assembly/installation of equipment/components for testing and/or flight configuration
* Understand technical documentation and work according to company procedures and technical drawings
* Prepare, handle, apply, and dispose of chemicals such as thermal fillers, various types of epoxy resins, flammable liquids, etc
* Produce wiring such as cable assemblies for both terrestrial and space applications
* Calibrate and correctly use: dynamometric tools/crimping tools (mechanical and wiring) and required laboratory hardware
* Keep integration areas (tools, toolboxes, workstations, etc.) clean and organized, adhering to company policy
* Operate manual tools such as screwdrivers, torque wrenches, tweezers, scissors, etc
* Use machining tools/facilities for small fabrications, modifications, and rework
* Soldering for cable assemblies and small PCB rework
* Assist in the flight integration activities of the spacecraft
* Assess proposed designs for manufacturability and integration into subsystems
* Develop and refine manufacturing and assembly procedures based on lessons learned to mature processes.
* Provide support for in\\-house or third\\-party environmental testing campaigns (TVAC, vibration, acoustics, EMI/EMC, etc.) for company products at both subsystem and system levels.
* Assess proposed designs for manufacturability and integration into subsystems
* Perform other tasks/responsibilities as assigned


**Requirements**
* Experience in a production environment with mechanical and electronic assemblies
* Ability to read, understand, and follow detailed work instructions for flight module testing
* Aerospace industry experience is preferred but not mandatory
* Proficiency with a variety of testing equipment, including power supplies, DC loads, DAQ, and test cabling
* Desired experience in one of the following areas:
* Cleanroom and electrostatic discharge (ESD) protection work
* Detailed assembly and mounting work
* Understanding of technical documentation
* Handling of chemicals and hazardous materials
* Handling and soldering of electrical components
* Harnessing methods
* Inspections of critical electronic/electrical/electromechanical hardware
* Meticulous attention to detail and documentation
* Troubleshooting skills to identify and resolve technical challenges
* Strong communication skills with the ability to provide and receive constructive feedback
* Fluent knowledge of English (oral and written) is required
* Possession of a valid driver's license (Category B)


**Benefits**
**We Offer:**
* A dynamic and stimulating work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Metalmeccanico (CCNL) with compensation based on experience and skills.


 SPACE INDUSTRIES is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion in its workplace and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or any other characteristic.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
* A unique opportunity for professional growth in a young and dynamic aerospace company.
* The chance to work on innovative projects with a global impact in the small satellite sector.
* A stimulating and collaborative environment, with the opportunity to contribute to shaping the company's future strategies

title: Assistente IT Junior
Assistant Chief Engineer
description:
Dana è un leader mondiale nella fornitura di tecnologie di tenuta, trasmissione e gestione termica di alta ingegneria che migliorano l'efficienza e le prestazioni dei veicoli con sistemi di trasmissione sia tradizionali sia ad energia alternativa. Al servizio di tre mercati principali: autovetture, autocarri industriali e attrezzature off\\-highway, Dana fornisce ai produttori di apparecchiature originali mondiali e all'aftermarket il supporto per prodotti e servizi locali attraverso una rete di circa 100 stabilimenti di progettazione, produzione e distribuzione.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 We are looking for an
 **Assistant Chief Engineer** 
 in Rivoli (TO). The new resource will supports the Chief Engineer in coordinating the program execution according to the technical targets and is the direct interface with the Customer for the APQP engineering aspects
   

  

**Main opportunities and challenges:**
 Environment very fast with technical and coordinating tasks in a global organization that provides visibility and recognition. Improve technology skills and competencies on high complexity powertrains. Be engaged with top automotive OEMs and acquire 360° vision on new products development for electrified vehicles.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Reporting to Chief Engineer, leading the APQP engineering topics (DFMEA, SFMEA, SC/CC list, lessons learned implementation)
* Lead the integration in the design of the open points emerging from the APQP activities of other stakeholders (i.e. PFMEA, control plan) and coordinate other teams (i.e. FuSa, SW, GME) in integrating their deliverables in the design (i.e. CO\\- FMEDA, EoL testing).
* Support the approval process for the customer input requirements, coordinating with the System Requirements Engineer.
* Support the achievement of the product quality readiness according to company processes and standards.
* Support the Technical Reviews Assessments of suppliers and sub\\- suppliers in collaboration with the Product Design Lead.
* Support in the DVP\\&R execution and reporting of test results, coordinating problem solving when needed.
* Collaborate with the Engineering Project Manager in the Risk Management process.


**Job Position Requirements**
 Education: University bachelor degree
   

  

**Professional background**
* Proven experience in a similar role within automotive or aeronautic industries.
* Solid understanding of Dual Clutch Transmission (DCT) systems, including architecture, functionality, and integration aspects.
* Proficiency in technical drawing and mechanical design, with the ability to interpret and create detailed engineering documentation.
* Ideally, familiarity with powertrain systems and transmissions, including their components, interactions, and performance characteristics


**Hard Skills**
 Essential:
   

  

* Fluent English\\-speaking skills and willingness to travel
* Experience in Electric Drive Unit design and development
* Knowledge of automotive product development processes


 Considered as a plus:
   

  

* Experience using computer\\-aided design (CAD) platforms
* Master’s degree in engineering or MBA
* 3\\+ year experience in similar role in automotive, mobile or aeronautic companies


**Soft Skills**
* Strong communication, interpersonal, and conflict resolution skills
* Work globally in cross\\-functional teams
* Critical thinking and problem\\-solving skills


 “If you are not contacted within 60 days after your application, the search should be considered filled. In compliance with law obligations and GDPR, your application could be considered for further opportunities aligned with your profile"
   

  

 Siamo un'azienda che offre pari opportunità di lavoro (Equal Opportunity Employer) e non discriminiamo i dipendenti o i candidati in base a razza, colore, religione, sesso, età, origine, orientamento sessuale, identità di genere, stato di veterano, disabilità o qualsiasi altra categoria protetta a livello federale, statale o locale.
   

  

 Curricula non richiesti da parte di recruiter terzi
   

  

 Notare che secondo quanto previsto dalla politica di Dana, non accettiamo curricula non richiesti da parte di recruiter terzi a meno che tali recruiter non siano stati incaricati di fornire dei candidati per una specifica posizione. Qualsiasi agenzia per il lavoro, persona o ente che invierà un curriculum non richiesto, lo farà sapendo che Dana avrà il diritto ad assumere il candidato a sua discrezione senza dover alcun compenso all'agenzia per il lavoro, alla persona o all'ente che avrà inviato il cv.

title: Addetto/a Vendita – Formazione e crescita professionale
description:
Ti piace il contatto con le persone? Sei appassionato al mondo della vendita? Hai un'attitudine positiva, un'energia contagiosa e un forte spirito di squadra?
   

  

 Allora potresti essere il nostro prossimo
 **Addetto/a Vendite** 
 !
   

  

 Siamo un'azienda dinamica e in forte crescita, e stiamo cercando una persona appassionata, entusiasta e pronta a mettersi in gioco per offrirci il suo supporto in un ambiente vivace e stimolante. Non importa se hai già esperienza nel settore o se sei alle prime armi: quello che conta di più è la tua voglia di imparare, crescere e fare parte di un team che crede nel valore delle persone.
   

  

 Posizione:
   

  

**Di cosa ti occuperai:**
* Accogliere i clienti con positività.
* Gestire lo stand con ordine e professionalità.
* Raggiungere gli obiettivi con entusiasmo e spirito di squadra.


**Cosa ti offriamo:**
* Un ambiente di lavoro giovane, dinamico e stimolante, dove ogni giorno è un’opportunità per imparare qualcosa di nuovo.
* Un programma di formazione completo e continuo, per supportarti nella crescita professionale e nelle tue aspirazioni.
* L’opportunità di entrare in un team affiatato.
* Un percorso di carriera concreto, con possibilità di crescita interna per chi si impegna e dimostra dedizione.
* flessibilità oraria.


 Requisiti:
   

  

*Sei pronto/a per questa nuova avventura?*
 Se ti piace lavorare in un ambiente dove le persone sono sempre al centro, dove il lavoro di squadra è fondamentale e dove puoi davvero fare la differenza, allora non esitare a inviarci la tua candidatura.
   

  

 Siamo entusiasti di conoscerti e di vedere che energia e passione saprai portare nel nostro team!

title: Avviso pubblico di selezione per il conferimento di n.1 incarico per la redazione del Progetto esecutivo per lo sviluppo e la gestione delle collezioni analogiche e digitali della BEIC
description:
La procedura di valutazione comparativa, rivolta a soggetti dotati dei necessari requisiti di professionalità, maturata in Italia e/o all’estero, è finalizzata a conferire:
   

  

**n. 1 incarico per la redazione del Progetto esecutivo per lo sviluppo e la gestione delle collezioni analogiche e digitali della** 
**Biblioteca Europea di Informazione e Cultura \\- BEIC.**
 Oggetto dell'incarico:
   

  

 definizione della Carta delle collezioni monografiche e seriali della BEIC, redatta sulla base di un adattamento del modello Conspectus;
   

  

 definizione del Progetto e delle procedure per la revisione periodica delle raccolte;
   

  

 definizione dei criteri di conservazione delle raccolte;
   

  

 definizione delle strategie di promozione e valorizzazione delle raccolte.
   

  

 L’incarico sarà svolto su input e in stretta collaborazione con i due Direttori Scientifici, con i quali il professionista preliminarmente delineerà le linee di sviluppo.
   

  

 Per ciascuno dei punti sopra elencati dovrà essere prodotta una relazione in lingua italiana.
   

  

 La collaborazione sopra citata sarà espletata personalmente dal soggetto selezionato, in piena autonomia, senza vincoli di subordinazione, in funzione delle finalità individuate dalla Fondazione BEIC, d’intesa con il Comune di Milano.
   

  

 L’attività si svolgerà su un arco temporale indicativo di 14 mesi e il compenso previsto è pari ad euro 30\\.000,00 (trentamila/00\\) omnicomprensivo di qualsiasi onere a carico della Fondazione BEIC e del soggetto incaricato, quali, a titolo esemplificativo e non esaustivo, oneri previdenziali ed ogni altro contributo e onere di legge eventualmente previsto.

title: Data Analyst for our Data Office (m/f/n)
description:
**Department:** 
 Markets Services \\|
 **Location:** 
 Esch\\-sur\\-Alzette \\|
 **Contract:** 
 Permanent \\|
   

  

**Job Requisition N°** 
 19819
   

  

 Join Enovos Luxembourg’s Data Office to help build a truly data‑driven company. As a Data Analyst, you’ll turn cross‑system data into trustworthy products that power our ERP migration and enable analytics \\- and help shape our new data platform.
   

  

**Your tasks**
* You translate business questions into data products and shared, durable metrics for ERP migration and beyond.
* You build and maintain curated datasets and dashboards, and automate cleaning, validation, and reconciliation.
* You profile sources, quantify and close data\\-quality gaps at origin, and validate readiness with clear test plans.
* You apply analytics to surface trends and opportunities.
* You instrument tests, freshness checks, and alerts, publish owners, lineage, and definitions in the catalogue.
* You triage data incidents, quantify impact, and communicate recovery timelines.
* You coach domain teams on product\\-minded analytics (metrics, quality, catalogue, delivery) through short workshops, hands\\-on labs, peer\\-working, and working procedure.
* You partner with Business Analysts, Data Stewards, Data Engineers, and the Data Architect to align scope and delivery, and document lineage and metadata in the central catalogue.


**Your profile**
* You hold a university degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering or equivalent.
* You have experience in translating business questions into user stories, shared metrics, and acceptance tests.
* You have experience with modern analytics stacks, including SQL/Python, data testing/profiling, and BI tools (Tableau/Power BI); you automate checks and reproducible workflows.
* You are a proactive team player who communicates clearly, aligns stakeholders on shared definitions, and documents ownership/lineage in the catalog.
* You act with ownership under change—customer\\-focused, curious, and relentlessly results\\-driven.
* You are highly effective verbal and written communication skills in English. A good knowledge of German and/or French will be considered as an advantage.


**What We Offer**
 “Together we build the future of Luxembourg’s energy transition”
   

  

* The opportunity to join a Group that actively shapes the energy transition in Luxembourg and the Greater Region
* A multicultural and international working environment that encourages diversity and inclusion
* A competitive salary with additional benefits (e.g. pension plan, additional health insurance, meal vouchers, free parking, company restaurant, etc.)
* A significant stability of employment and the possibility to evolve within the Group
* Continuous learning and development career path adapted to the needs of each employee
* Hybrid working mode with the possibility to work from home


 For external applications, a recent copy of the police record will be requested if you are invited for an interview.

 :

title: Channel Marketing Manager
description:
**Overall Job Description** 




 The Channel Marketing position is responsible for defining and developing global programs in a multi\\-channel environment that support the coordination and maximization of channel partner success in selling Matica Group products and services to targeted markets. This includes definition, development, and management of Matica Group’s channel marketing programs. It also includes channel training, channel events, joint partner marketing opportunities, business development, and channel marketing deliverables including sales tools.
 



 For the studies and planning part, the channel marketing manager should help guiding strategic marketing and sales efforts and help the management to make informed business decisions by providing valuable insights into market trends, customer behavior, and competitive landscapes.
 



  





**Major Job Responsibilities** 



* Develop overall channel marketing plan including definition, implementation, promotion, effectiveness and partners satisfaction measurement.
* Coordination, management, administration and execution of channel programs and campaigns (e.g. MDF, Deal Registration, Partner Portal, Appreciation, etc.).
* Coordination of Matica Group involvement in major partner events including user conferences, exhibits at industry trade events.
* Market sensing to identify emerging channel opportunities.
* Development and deployment of selling tools and materials (e.g. ROI models, white papers, sales kits/welcome kits, videos, collateral, webinars, etc.) in conjunction with the Marketing Communication Manager
* Development and delivery of channel sales training.
* Assistance to Matica Group Channels Sales team and to channel partners in support of sales opportunities.
* Sales support to channel partners for resolution of issues and questions.
* Develop annual plans and budgets and manage to define expectations and objectives.
* Launch and manage marketing projects (like CRM implementation and development), including project management dimensions by providing activity plans, status monitoring, milestones management, issues highlighting and solution definition.
* CRM roll\\-out, management and development throughout all Matica Group organization and Distribution
* Market Research: conduct comprehensive market research to identify trends, opportunities, and potential threats. Gather data on market size, growth rates, and key players.
* Competitor Analysis: Monitor and analyze competitor activities, products, and strategies. Identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities.
* Customer Analysis: Segment and profile our current and potential customer base to understand their needs, preferences, and behavior. Use this information to define marketing strategies.
* Data Analysis: Collect and analyze data from various sources, including surveys, customer feedback, and industry reports. Use statistical techniques to derive meaningful insights.
* Reporting: Prepare reports and presentations summarizing research findings, market trends, and recommendations for senior management.



  





**Knowledge and Skills** 




**General Marketing** 



* Development and management of marketing strategies, mix, and tactics in support of business objectives.
* Project management.
* Very strong work ethic.
* Microsoft application use.
* Outstanding communication skills (written, verbal, presentation).
* Customer and partner engagement skills.
* Collaboration and consensus building with multiple internal functions.
* Analytical skills and Business Acumen.
* Fluent in Italian and working knowledge of English
* Banking and check processing skills considered a plus.
* Working knowledge of another Latin language (Spanish, Portuguese, French) considered a plus.
* Salesforce system knowledge and use is considered a plus.
* Passion for data\\-driven decision\\-making and a willingness to practice market research techniques



  





**Position Specifics** 



* 5\\+ years of business and market development experience.
* Undergraduate degree in marketing and/or management, master degree preferred.
* Channel plan development within the context of a multi\\-channel global environment.
* Channel segmentation strategies.
* Financial analysis of joint partner programs including ROI and IRR.
* Channel programs, campaigns, and sales tools development.
* Channel training.
* CRM tool development and deployment.
* Experience in utilizing channels to develop markets in a B2B context.



  





**About Matica** 




 Matica is a global leader in secure ID issuance and financial card personalization solutions. With innovative hardware, software, and services, we provide high\\-quality and scalable solutions to banks, government agencies, and enterprises worldwide.
 



  





**Why Join Us** 



* Be part of an innovative, growing team building next generation solutions for the Secure ID and Payment sector
* Work in a fast paced, collaborative and agile environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.

title: IT Technician
description:
The
 **Adler Pelzer Group** 
 is the world's leading supplier of acoustic and thermal insulation for the automotive industry with more than 16,000 employees at over 110 production sites. We serve all the world's major automotive manufacturers as a system supplier and development partner.
   

  

 Adler Evo srl, for the
 **Santhià Plant, located in Santhià (VC)** 
 , is looking for a
 **IT Technician** 
 .
   

  

 Objectives of the position
   

  

 The IT Technician's role encompasses the daily technical support and management of IT resources, focusing on end\\-user satisfaction, troubleshooting, and system maintenance. This position is pivotal in maintaining the organization's IT environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* End\\-User Support: Provide technical assistance and prompt troubleshooting to end\\-users for hardware and software issues, ensuring minimal disruption to their work.
* Hardware Maintenance: Maintain, repair, and upgrade desktops, laptops, peripherals, and other hardware equipment as needed.
* Software Support: Install, configure, and update software applications, ensuring proper functionality.
* Network Assistance: Assist in network configuration and maintenance, resolving connectivity issues.
* Cybersecurity Measures: Assist in implementing and maintaining security measures, including access controls and antivirus software.
* Documentation: Maintain accurate records of hardware and software inventory, configurations, and support requests.
* Ticketing System Management: Use the IT ticketing system to efficiently track, prioritize, and resolve technical issues.
* Basic System Maintenance: Perform routine maintenance tasks such as system updates and patches.


**Requirements**
* Proficiency in desktop and server operating systems (Windows, Linux, etc.).
* Basic knowledge of network protocols and configurations.
* Hardware troubleshooting and maintenance skills.
* Familiarity with software installation, configuration, and updates.
* Understanding of cybersecurity best practices.
* Good level of written English proficiency, a strong oral communication skill would be viewed as a plusSOF.
* Availability to travel to neighbouring plants


**Skills**
* Leadership;
* Excellent time and planning skills;
* Good interpersonal and communication skills;
* Flexibility, enthusiasm and motivation;
* Real team player, ability to create enthusiasm and team spirit;
* Proactive and assertive;
* Able to work under pressure in order to meet deadlines.


**Preferred**
* Relevant certifications, such as CompTIA A\\+ or Microsoft Certified Desktop Support Technician (MCDST).
* Knowledge of virtualization technologies.
* Familiarity with cloud computing platforms.
* Scripting or programming skills (e.g., PowerShell, Python).
* Basic understanding of data backup and recovery procedures

title: Architetto del software
description:
Akkodis è un leader globale nel mercato dell'ingegneria e della ricerca e sviluppo, che mira ad accelerare l'innovazione e la trasformazione digitale utilizzando la forza dei connected data.
 



 Con la passione per la tecnologia e il talento, il gruppo, composto da più di 50\\.000 ingegneri ed esperti digitali e con un fatturato di €4bn, offre una profonda esperienza intersettoriale in 28 paesi tra Nord America, EMEA e APAC.
 











 Akkodis vanta un’esperienza quarantennale e un forte know\\-how in settori tecnologici chiave come la mobilità, i servizi software e tecnologici, la robotica, i test, le simulazioni, la sicurezza dei dati, l'intelligenza artificiale e l'analisi dei dati.
 











 La combinazione di competenze informatiche e ingegneristiche porta a un'offerta unica di soluzioni end\\-to\\-end, con quattro linee di servizio \\- Consulting, Solutions, Talents e Academy \\- per supportare i clienti nel ripensare ai loro processi di sviluppo prodotto e di business, migliorare la produttività, ridurre al minimo il time\\-to\\-market e dare forma a un domani più smart e sostenibile.
 











 La divisione Aerospace, Defence, Naval and Railway di Akkodis è leader nei servizi ingegneristici per le industrie aerospaziale, difesa, navale e ferroviaria. Composta da un team di ingegneri e consulenti altamente qualificati, con una solida esperienza in progetti complessi, la divisione garantisce soluzioni innovative negli ambiti di progettazione e sviluppo di sistemi, integrazione e collaudo, gestione della supply chain, supporto alla certificazione in conformità alle normative militari e civili. Grazie a collaborazioni con importanti attori del settore ed a un costante aggiornamento sulle tecnologie emergenti, Akkodis è in grado di fornire un supporto completo e personalizzato per affrontare le sfide del mercato globale.
 











  





  













 Nell’ottica di un potenziamento della divisione, ricerchiamo una figura di:
 







  





  





  





**Architetto Software** 












  









 Entra a far parte della nostra divisione Aerospace, Defence, Naval and Railway presente in Italia e nelle altre Region Mondiali.
 











  





  

























**Quale sarà il tuo contributo in Akkodis?** 
















  









  





  









 Ti occuperai della
 
 progettazione della struttura di alto livello e le specifiche tecniche di un sistema software, traducendo i requisiti. Si occupa di definire la visione del sistema, scegliere le tecnologie appropriate e stabilire standard per garantire l'efficienza del software.
 







  




* Supporto nella preparazione della documentazione per la consolidazione della Baseline dei Requisiti, del documento dei Requisiti di Interfaccia Software







  




* Definizione degli standard: stabilire linee guida e standard per lo sviluppo e la qualità del codice.



  




* Supervisione dello sviluppo: coordinare e guidare il team di sviluppatori per assicurare che l'implementazione segua le specifiche architettoniche.











  





  

















**Hai una laurea Triennale o Magistrale in Ingegneria Aeronautica/Aerospaziale e 3 anni di esperienza come softwarista e nella costruzione dell’architettura software?** 












  





  





  









**About you** 












  

















 Requisiti per iniziare il tuo percorso di crescita:
 











  












* Conoscenze di RTOS
* Conoscenza UML
* Conoscenza della lingua inglese























  





  





**Offerta** 




















  









 Contratto a tempo indeterminato
 











  





  













 💼 Cosa troverai in Akkodis?
 



















  












* Un
 **percorso di carriera** 
 strutturato e personalizzato, con possibilità di crescita verticale e trasversale
* Ti supporteremo grazie ai nostri
 **piani di formazione** 
 , ad una
 **performance review annuale** 
 , ad un
 **affiancamento** 
 nelle fasi iniziali di ingresso, unitamente a
 **follow\\-up** 
 con
 **figure Manageriali e HR Business Partner**
* Avrai a disposizione una
 **Piattaforma di Corporate Benefits**















  





  









**Location** 








  





  





 Torino

title: Data Scientist (Team Lead)
description:
Docsity is an educational community where millions of university students share and find study content to improve their exam preparation. Our mission is to help students to be more effective in their preparation, and connect them with meaningful learning opportunities.
 



  





 We are managing this recruitment process in collaboration with one of our strategic partner companies, who are looking for talented individuals to join their team.
 



  





 The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 You will collaborate closely with interdisciplinary teams to design and implement advanced
 **AI solutions** 
 that drive decision\\-making and innovation. Your daily activities will include:
 


* Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, and structuring for downstream processing
* Develop architectures to streamline data science processes
* Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization
* Promote data\\-based decision\\-making across the company through reports and presentations
* Develop insightful dashboards to track performances



  





**Requirements:** 



* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
* Great analytical skills and attention to detail, insights\\-driven attitude
* Fluency in
 **Python** 
 , Pandas, and database technology (SQL, schema design and query optimization techniques)
* Expertise in using BI tools (e.g. Looker, Looker Data Studio, Tableau, AWS QuickSight)
* Understanding of full software development life cycle and agile development
* Proficiency in Italian (B2\\+)



  





*Nice to have* 



* experience in Large Language Models APIs or quantitative analytics or data modeling is a plus
* Expertise in using BI tools (e.g. Looker, Looker Data Studio, Tableau, AWS QuickSight)
* Experience on Ecommerce and digital marketing metrics
* Expertise in using scalable analytics techniques (e.g., PySpark, Dask, Modin, Koalas) and MPP databases (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake) for complex data assembly and transformation



  





**What’s in it for you?** 



* Work with tons of data, to which you will have full access
* Work closely with all functions within the organization
* You’ll have the unique chance to work on high\\-impact Data/AI projects within a large\\-scale organization where your contributions will drive tangible change
* Work in a highly\\-skilled, organized and cross\\-functional Data Team
* Opportunity to grow personally and professionally through training and peer interaction
* **Hybrid work structure: 4 days in the office and 1 day of smart working per week.**

title: Marketing Trainee
description:
****The Impact You'll Make****
 Are you a motivated and curious professional, ready to take your first steps in strategic marketing and contribute with fresh, concrete ideas? Join Danfoss!
   

  

 For our Drives Division, we are looking for a Marketing Trainee to support marketing initiatives, enhance customer engagement, and participate in the development of innovative campaigns, learning tools and strategies in a dynamic and stimulating environment.
   

  

****What You’ll Be Doing****
* Support the development and execution of marketing plans and campaigns, including digital marketing, social media, and email activities, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
* Create, adapt, and validate marketing materials and graphic assets for internal use and co\\-marketing with partners, ensuring brand consistency and accuracy.
* Collect, review, and analyze marketing data to provide insights that support decision\\-making and improve campaign effectiveness.
* Coordinate and support events and initiatives at local and international levels, collaborating with internal teams and external partners and assisting with logistics and execution.


****What We're Looking For****
* Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communication, or a related field.
* Basic understanding of marketing principles and project management; eagerness to learn how to plan, prioritize, and manage tasks effectively.
* Familiarity with marketing tools, digital channels, and content creation principles; basic knowledge of graphic design and branding guidelines is a plus.
* Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills, with clear written and verbal communication.
* Customer\\-focused mindset, with an interest in understanding customer needs and creating value.
* Basic knowledge of products and applications in the Drives Division, with willingness to develop expertise.
* Strong proficiency in both Italian and English, written and spoken.
* Availability for local and international travel when required.


****What You'll Get from Us****
* We promote from within and support your learning with mentoring, training, and access to global opportunities.
* You’ll have flexibility, autonomy, and support to do your best work while maintaining a healthy work\\-life balance. Your well\\-being matters to us.
* We strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are respected, and valued for who they are.
* You’ll receive benefits like 13th salary, annual bonus, paid vacation, pension plans, personal insurance, and more. These vary by country and contract, but they’re worth asking about—we think they’re pretty great.


****Ready to Make a Difference?****
 If this role excites you, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now to start the conversation and learn more about where your career can go with us.
   

  

 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.

title: SENIOR AUDITOR - TO
description:
**Chi siamo?**
 Siamo parte di Crowe Global, tra i primi 10 network internazionali leader nei servizi professionali. In Italia operiamo attraverso quattro società: la
 **Crowe Bompani Assurance Services SpA** 
 e la
 **Crowe Bompani Srl** 
 dedicate ai servizi di revisione e organizzazione contabile e agli altri servizi di assurance; la
 **Crowe Bompani Advisory Srl** 
 che si occupa di servizi di consulenza nei diversi ambiti tra cui Sostenibilità, Risk Management, Digital Transformation, Corporate Finance, Management Consulting, Forensic Accounting; la Crowe Bompani Academy Srl Benefit che offre percorsi di formazione altamente specializzati a professionisti, manager e imprenditori.
   

  

 Con oltre 200 professionisti distribuiti in uffici presenti in tutta Italia, vogliamo distinguerci per le elevate competenze tecniche, l’attenzione al cliente e la passione per l'innovazione. Siamo orgogliosi di avere team qualificati con differenti specializzazioni, perseguiamo da anni la parità di genere e infatti il 43% delle risorse umane è rappresentato da donne. Offriamo a tutti i nostri collaboratori le stesse opportunità di crescita professionale e di carriera attraverso percorsi predefiniti e stimolanti che comprendono una formazione continua in aula e sul campo.
   

  

 Credendo fortemente nella Sostenibilità e nell’Innovazione, pilastri della nostra cultura aziendale, da anni integriamo i principi ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) in ogni nostra attività, lavorando costantemente per ridurre l’impatto ambientale e promuovendo pratiche di business sostenibili. Adottiamo misure concrete, come procedure paperless, la creazione di uffici plastic\\-free contribuendo a costruire un futuro sempre più sostenibile. Offriamo quindi un ambiente di lavoro stimolante e inclusivo, dove ogni individuo può esprimere il proprio potenziale e partecipare al successo della squadra. Attraverso la nostra Academy, investiamo nella crescita professionale delle nostre risorse e offriamo percorsi di formazione personalizzati e opportunità di sviluppo continuo.
   

  

**Chi cerchiamo?**
 Cerchiamo un
 **Senior Auditor** 
 per la sede di Torino che contribuisca ad accrescere la struttura di Crowe Bompani che abbia voglia di affrontare insieme a noi ogni giorno nuove sfide mettendosi in gioco in un ambiente che valorizza le competenze e le propensioni di ciascuno.
   

  

 Il ruolo del Senior in Crowe Bompani significa:
   

  

* Essere parte attiva del team di audit in tutte le fasi del processo di revisione.
* Lavorare in modo efficace come membro del team, condividendo le responsabilità, fornendo supporto, mantenendo la comunicazione e aggiornando i manager sui progressi.
* Supportare, coordinare e formare i colleghi junior
* Assistere nella preparazione di report e programmi che verranno consegnati ai clienti e ad altre parti.
* Gestire e risolvere problemi ad hoc che si verificano


 Se sei una persona proattiva, orientata al risultato ed interessata a lavorare in sinergia in un ambiente altamente professionale entra nel mondo di Crowe Bompani!
   

  

 La/il candidata/o ideale di Crowe Bompani ha queste caratteristiche:
   

  

* Laurea in Economia
* Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
* 3\\-4 anni di esperienza nella stessa posizione e conoscenza del settore/servizi professionali
* Predisposizione al teamwork e motivazione alla crescita professionale
* Versatilità
* Leadership
* Capacità di pianificazione ed organizzazione del lavoro
* Disponibilità ad intraprendere il percorso per iscriversi agli albi professionali
* Disponibilità a trasferte


**Che cosa offriamo?**
 In Crowe Bompani il successo inizia dalla passione per il proprio lavoro e pertanto offriamo alla candidata o al candidato scelta/o la possibilità di lavorare a stretto contatto con Partners e Managers, l’opportunità di entrare in un contesto internazionale e dinamico, di avere a disposizione piani di crescita e sviluppo nonché di un sistema di formazione interno e on the job finalizzato al raggiungimento dell’iscrizione agli albi professionali (ODCEC/Revisore legale), un sistema di welfare aziendale all’avanguardia e un contesto sfidante in forte crescita.

title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER F/M
Strategic Business Analyst
description:
A Joint Venture between Thales (67%) and Leonardo (33%), Thales Alenia Space is a global space manufacturer delivering, for more than 40 years, high\\-tech solutions for telecommunications, navigation, Earth Observation, environmental management, exploration, science and orbital infrastructures. Thanks to our diversity of skills, talents and cultures, our customers (governments, institutions, space agencies, telecommunications operators), therefore have Space to Connect, Secure \\& Defend, Observe \\& Protect, Explore, Travel \\& Navigate.
   

  

 We are looking for an Strategic Business Analyst
   

  

 Key duties:
   

  

* Undertake market research \\& analysis, and assess market trends, specifically for Human and Robotic Space Exploration, Space Infrastructure and Science domains
* Identify new business opportunities and define value propositions
* Develop and document business cases to substantiate new opportunities, identifying perimeter of the initiative/project, business models, alternatives, strengths and weaknesses, benefits and risks, and a preliminary assessment of involved costs, investments, revenues, timescale, organization \\& governance aspects
* For selected initiatives of interest, develop and document a more detailed business plan, further analyzing service or product idea, roadmap, commercialization approach and associated most suitable organizational structure, customers and competitors stance, industrial response implications, amount and source of initial funding, financial modeling and financial forecasts including ROI and cash flow forecasts
* Contribute to assessment and due diligence for possible investments and M\\&As
* In close cooperation with Domain Operations and Production Units, contribute to the preparation and justification of evolution roadmap for industrial CAPEX (new facilities, new plants…)
* In support to the Product Line Managers and Product Managers, contribute to business estimates and planning for existing product lines
* In support to bids preparation, (i) assess customer requests for specific business forecasts or justifications and prepare the associated response to be included in the proposal data package, (ii) contribute to the identification of business and financial risks and opportunities to be included in the risk register


 Skills, experience and qualifications required:
   

  

* Master’s degree in Finance, Economics or Business Administration
* At least 5 years of experience in market research \\& analysis, financial modeling, preparation \\& development of business cases and business plans
* Previous experience in corporate strategy and finance are preference criteria
* Data analysis and visualization
* Business and financial modeling
* Strong written and verbal communication, including technical writing skills
* Critical thinking
* Storytelling
* Comfortable with uncertainty, complexity and ambiguity
* Understanding of (space) systems engineering concepts
* Fluent in English language
* Ability to work with cross\\-functional teams


 Location: Torino (Italy) Permanent position
   

  

 At Thales Alenia Space we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales Alenia Space employing around 8,900 employees in 10 countries with 17 sites in Europe and a plant in the US, our mobility policy enables employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad. Thales Alenia Space sees space as a new horizon, helping to build a better, more sustainable life on Earth \\#SpaceForLife. Great journeys start here, apply now!
